column4: [Inglês] Reproductive biology of Cyrtopodium polyphyllum (Orchidaceae): a Cyrtopodiinae pollinated by deceit
column5: [Inglês] The genus Cyrtopodium comprises about 42 species distributed from southern Florida to northern Argentina. Cyrtopodium polyphyllum occurs on rocks or in sandy soilsVIRGULA in restinga vegetation along the Brazilian coast. It flowers during the wet season and its inflorescences produce a high number of resupinate yellow flowers. Cyrtopodium polyphyllum offers no rewards to its pollinatorsVIRGULA but mimics the yellowVIRGULA reward-producing flowers of nearby growing Stigmaphyllon arenicola (oil) and Crotalaria vitellina (nectar) individuals. Several species of bee visit flowers of C. polyphyllumVIRGULA but only two species of Centris (Centris tarsata and Centris labrosa) act as pollinators. Visits to flowers of C. polyphyllum were scarce andVIRGULA as a consequenceVIRGULA low-fruit set was recorded under natural conditions. Such low-fruit production contrasts with the number of fruits each plant bears after manual pollinationVIRGULA suggesting deficient pollen transfer among plants. C. polyphyllum is self-compatible and has a high-fruit set in both manual self- and cross-pollinated flowers. FurthermoreVIRGULA fruits (2%) are formed by self-pollination assisted by rain. This facultative self-pollination mechanism is an important strategy to provide reproductive assurance to C. polyphyllum as rainfall restricts the foraging activity of its pollinating bees. Fruits derived from treatments and under natural conditions had a similar high rate of potentially viable seed. MoreoverVIRGULA these seeds had a low polyembryony rateVIRGULA which did not exceed 5%. C. polyphyllum acts by deceit involving optical signals and exploits other yellow-flowered species within its habitat by attracting their pollinators. The low capsule production under natural conditions was expectedVIRGULA but its reproductive success is assured through self-pollination by rain and high seed viability. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Estimation of biomass and carbon stocks: the case of the Atlantic ForestVIRGULA [Português] Estimativas de biomassa e estoque de carbono: o caso da Mata Atlântica
column5: [Português] O principal objetivo deste artigo é apresentar e discutir a melhor forma para estimar a biomassa viva acima do solo (BVS) na Mata Atlântica. A biomassa viva acima do solo em florestas tropicais esta contida principalmente nas árvores. A biomassa das árvores é uma função do seu volume de madeiraVIRGULA obtido do diâmetro e da alturaVIRGULA de sua arquitetura e da densidade de sua madeira (peso seco por unidade de volume fresco). Ela pode ser quantificada pelo método direto (destrutivo) ou pelo método indireto onde a quantificação da biomassa é feita através de modelos matemáticos. Os modelos alométricos podem ser específicos para um determinado localVIRGULA quando elaborado para um ecossistema particularVIRGULA ou geraisVIRGULA que podem ser utilizados em para estimar a biomassa em diferentes locais. Para a Mata AtlânticaVIRGULA a despeito de sua importânciaVIRGULA existem somente duas medidas diretas de biomassa de árvoresVIRGULA que resultaram em modelos alométricos específicos para essas florestas. Para selecionar um ou outro modelo alométrico para estimar BVSVIRGULA disponível na literaturaVIRGULA é necessário levar em conta o a questão a ser respondida e a facilidade com a qual é possível medir as variáveis independentes do modelo. PreferencialmenteVIRGULA deve-se utilizar modelos que apresentem estimativas mais acuradasVIRGULA entretanto modelos mais simples (aqueles com apenas uma variável independenteVIRGULA normalmente o DAP) podem ser utilizados quando o foco for o monitoramento das variação no estoque de carbono através do tempo. Observações para a Mata Atlântica sugerem que o modelo pan-tropical proposto por Chave et al. (2005) podem ser utilizadas com confiança entre os biomasVIRGULA uma vez que o mesmo engloba o DAP a altura e a densidade da madeira. Na Mata AtlânticaVIRGULA onde as lianasVIRGULA bambusVIRGULA palmeirasVIRGULA fetos arborescentes e epífitas são um importante componente do sistemaVIRGULA recomenda-se a quantificação dos mesmos... (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The main objective of this paper is to present and discuss the best methods to estimate live above ground biomass in the Atlantic Forest. The methods presented and conclusions are the products of a workshop entitled "Estimation of Biomass and Carbon Stocks: the Case of Atlantic Rain Forest". Aboveground biomass (AGB) in tropical forests is mainly contained in trees. Tree biomass is a function of wood volumeVIRGULA obtained from the diameter and heightVIRGULA architecture and wood density (dry weight per unit volume of fresh wood). It can be quantified by the direct (destructive) or indirect method where the biomass quantification is estimated using mathematical models. The allometric model can be site specific when elaborated to a particular ecosystem or general that can be used in different sites. For the Atlantic ForestVIRGULA despite the importance of itVIRGULA there are only two direct measurements of tree biomassVIRGULA resulting in allometric models specific for this ecosystem. To select one or other of the available models in the iterature to estimate AGB it is necessary take into account what is the main question to be answered and the ease with which it is possible to measure the independent variables in the model. Models that present more accurate estimates should be preferred. HoweverVIRGULA more simple models (those with one independent variableVIRGULA usually DBH) can be used when the focus is monitoring the variation in carbon storage through the time. Our observations in the Atlantic Forest suggest that pan-tropical relations proposed by Chave et al. (2005) can be confidently used to estimated tree biomass across biomes as long as tree diameter (DBH)VIRGULA heightVIRGULA and wood density are accounted for in the model. In Atlantic ForestVIRGULA we recommend the quantification of biomass of lianasVIRGULA bambooVIRGULA palmsVIRGULA tree ferns and epiphytesVIRGULA which are an important component in this ecosystem... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Short-term responses of photosynthesis to temperature and irradiance in the freshwater red alga Compsopogon coeruleus
column5: [Inglês] Short-term responses of photosynthetic characteristics to temperature and irradiance was analysed in the freshwater red alga Compsopogon coeruleus under field and laboratory conditions. Diurnal variation of "in vivo" chlorophyll fluorescence parameters was measured in two contrasting seasons (winter and fallVIRGULA dry and rainy seasonVIRGULA respectively) at one site located in a tropical region of southeastern Brazil (20°11'10" SVIRGULA 49°41'05" W). Photosynthesis-irradiance and dark/light (induction) curves were tested in laboratory under simulating winter and fall field conditions. Field and experimental data revealed characteristics of shade-adapted macroalgae: relatively low values of ETR (electron transfer rate) and high of NPQ (non-photochemical quenching) indicatingVIRGULA respectivelyVIRGULA a low capacity of photosystem (PII) energy conversion and a high capacity of heat dissipation of absorbed energy by reaction centres. Some mechanisms to cope with high irradiances were also evidenced: a negative correlation of EQY (effective quantum yieldVIRGULA F/Fm') with photosynthetically active radiation (PAR)VIRGULA suggesting a high excitation pressure on PIIPONTOCOMMA and a fast up and down regulation of NPQVIRGULA as heat dissipation of the excessive energy captured by reaction centre. Three other general characteristics were observed: 1) dynamic photoinhibitionVIRGULA indicated by a decrease followed by an increase of ETR in the induction curve under winter conditions (lower PAR)PONTOCOMMA 2) positive correlation of ETR with temperatureVIRGULA i.e. an increase of PII energy conversion by electron transfer directly coupled to a temperature increaseVIRGULA suggesting a temperature-dependent mechanismPONTOCOMMA 3) similar or higher values of EQY and PQY at the end of the dayVIRGULA suggesting good recovery capacity and lack of irreversible photodamage to the photosynthetic apparatus due to exposure to high PAR... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Selectivity in the mechanism of action of antimicrobial mastoparan peptide Polybia-MP1
column5: [Inglês] Many potent antimicrobial peptides also present hemolytic activityVIRGULA an undesired collateral effect for the therapeutic application. Unlike other mastoparan peptidesVIRGULA Polybia-MP1 (IDWKKLLDAAKQIL)VIRGULA obtained from the venom of the social wasp Polybia paulistaVIRGULA is highly selective of bacterial cells. The study of its mechanism of action demonstrated that it permeates vesicles at a greater rate of leakage on the anionic over the zwitterionicVIRGULA impaired by the presence of cholesterol or cardiolipinPONTOCOMMA its lytic activity is characterized by a threshold peptide to lipid molar ratio that depends on the phospholipid composition of the vesicles. At these particular threshold concentrationsVIRGULA the apparent average pore number is distinctive between anionic and zwitterionic vesiclesVIRGULA suggesting that pores are similarly formed depending on the ionic character of the bilayer. To prospect the molecular reasons for the strengthened selectivity in Polybia-MP1 and its absence in Mastoparan-XVIRGULA MD simulations were carried out. Both peptides presented amphipathic alpha-helical structuresVIRGULA as previously observed in Circular Dichroism spectraVIRGULA with important differences in the extension and stability of the helixPONTOCOMMA their backbone solvation analysis also indicate a different profileVIRGULA suggesting that the selectivity of Polybia-MP1 is a consequence of the distribution of the charged and polar residues along the peptide helixVIRGULA and on how the solvent molecules orient themselves according to these electrostatic interactions. We suggest that the lack of hemolytic activity of Polybia-MP1 is due to the presence and position of Asp residues that enable the equilibrium of electrostatic interactions and favor the preference for the more hydrophilic environment. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Myotoxic effects of mastoparan from Polybia paulista (HymenopteraVIRGULA Epiponini) wasp venom in mice skeletal muscle
column5: [Inglês] In a previous studyVIRGULA we showed that the Polybia paulista wasp venom causes strong myonecrosis. This study was undertaken to characterize the myotoxic potency of mastoparan (Polybia-MPII) isolated from venom (0.25 ug/ul) and injected in the tibial anterior (TA) muscle (i.m.) of Balb/c mice. The time course of the changes was followed at muscle degenerative (3 and 24 h) and regenerative (3VIRGULA 7VIRGULA and 21 days) periods (n=6) after injection and compared to matched controls by calculation of the percentage of cross-sectional area affected and determination of creatine kinase (CK) activity (n=10). The results showed that although MP was strongly myotoxicVIRGULA its capacity for regeneration was maintained high. Since the extent of tissue damage was not correlated with the CK serum levelsVIRGULA which remained very lowVIRGULA we raised the hypothesis that the enzyme underwent denaturation by the peptide. Evidence suggested that MP induced the death of TA fibers by necrosis and apoptosis and had the sarcolemma as its primordial target. Given its amphiphilic polycationic nature and based on the vast spectrum of functions attributed to the peptideVIRGULA we suggest that MP interaction with cell membrane impaired the phosphorylation of dystrophin essential for sarcolemma mechanical stabilityVIRGULA and disturbed Ca2+ mobilization with obvious implications on sarcoplasmic reticulum and mitochondrial functioning. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] The chelation of metal ions by the acylpolyamine toxins from the web-spider Nephilengys cruentata: effects in the intoxication/detoxification of preys
column5: [Inglês] Orb-web-spiders present a series of different strategies for prey captureVIRGULA involving the use of different types of silk for web buildingVIRGULA the use of adhesive traps in the websVIRGULA the secretion of toxic compounds to the spiders preys in the adhesive coating of the capture web and the biosynthesis of a wide range of structurally related acylpolyamine toxins in their venoms. The polyamine toxins usually block neuromuscular junctions and/or the central nervous system (CNS) of ArthropodsVIRGULA targeting specially the ionotropic glutamate receptorsPONTOCOMMA this way these toxins are used are as chemical weapons to kill / paralyze the spiders prey. Polyamine toxins contain many azamethylene groups involved with the chelation of metal ionsVIRGULA which in turn can interact with the glutamate receptorsVIRGULA affecting the toxicity of these toxins. It was demonstrated that the chelation of Ni+2VIRGULA Fe+2VIRGULA Pb+2VIRGULA Ca+2 and Mg+2 ions by the desalted crude venom of Nephilengys cruentata and by the synthetic toxin JSTX-3VIRGULA did not cause any significant change in the toxicity of the acylpolyamine toxins to the model-prey insect (honeybees). HoweverVIRGULA it was also reported that the chelation of Zn+2 ions by the acylpolyamines potentiated the lethal / paralytic action of these toxins to the honeybeesVIRGULA while the chelation of Cu+2 ions caused the inverse effect. Atomic absorption spectrometry and Plasma-ICP analysis both of N. cruentata venom and honeybees hemolymph revealed that the spiders venom concentrates Zn+2 ionsVIRGULA while the honeybees hemolymph concentrates Cu+2 ions. These results are suggesting that the natural accumulation of Zn+2 ions in N. cruentata venom favors the prey catching and/or its maintenance in the webVIRGULA while the natural accumulation of Cu+2 ions in preys hemolymph minimizes the efficiency of the acylpolyamine toxins as killing/paralyzing tool. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] The venomous secrets of the web droplets from the viscid spiral of the orb-weaver spider Nephila clavipes (AraneaeVIRGULA Tetragnatidae)
column5: [Inglês] The capture web of N. clavipes presents viscous dropletsVIRGULA which play important roles in web mechanics and prey capture. By using scanning and transmission electron microscopyVIRGULA it was demonstrated that the web droplets are constituted of different chemical environmentsVIRGULA provided by the existence both of an aqueous and a lipid layerVIRGULA whichVIRGULA in turnVIRGULA present a suspension of tenths of vesicles containing polypeptides and/or lipids. GC/EI-MS Analysis of the contents of these vesicles led to the identification of some saturated fatty acidsVIRGULA such as decanoic acidVIRGULA undecanoic acidVIRGULA dodecanoic acidVIRGULA tetradecanoic acidVIRGULA octadecanoic acidVIRGULA and icosanoic acidVIRGULA while other components were unsaturated fatty acidsVIRGULA such as (Z)-tetradec-9-enoic acidVIRGULA (Z)-octadec-9-enoic acidVIRGULA and (Z)-icosa-11-enoic acidPONTOCOMMA and polyunsaturated fatty acids like (9ZVIRGULA12Z)-octadeca-9VIRGULA12-dienoic acidVIRGULA (9ZVIRGULA12ZVIRGULA15Z)-octadeca-9VIRGULA12VIRGULA15-trienoic acidVIRGULA and (11ZVIRGULA14Z)-icosa-11VIRGULA14-dienoic acid. Toxic proteins such as calcium-activated proteinase and metalloproteinase jararhagin-like precursor were also identified by using a proteomic approachVIRGULA indicating the possible involvement of these enzymes in the pre-digestion of spiders' preys web-captured. ApparentlyVIRGULA the mixture of fatty acids are relatively toxic to insects by topical application (LD50 64.3±7.6 ng mg-1 honeybee)VIRGULA while the proteins alone present no topical effectPONTOCOMMA howeverVIRGULA when injected into the prey-insectsVIRGULA these proteins presented a moderate toxicity (LD50 40.3±4.8 ng mg-1 honeybee)PONTOCOMMA the mixture of fatty acids and proteins is very toxic to the preys captured by the web droplets of the viscid spiral of Nephila clavipes when topically applied on them (LD50 14.3±1.8 ng mg-1 honeybee). (AU)

column4: [Inglês] The antiepileptic activity of JSTX-3 is mediated by N-methyl-D-aspartate receptors in human hippocampal neurons
column5: [Inglês] We analyzed the effect of the acylpolyaminetoxin JSTX-3 on the epileptogenic discharges induced by perfusion of human hippocampal slices with artificial cerebrospinal fluid lacking Mg2+ or N-methyl-D-aspartate. Hippocampi were surgically removed from patients with refractory medial temporal lobe epilepsyVIRGULA sliced in the surgical room and taken to the laboratory immersed in normal artificial cerebrospinal fluid. Epileptiform activity was induced by perfusion with Mg2+-free artificial cerebrospinal fluid or by iontophoretically applied N-methyl-D-aspartate and intracellular and field recordings of CA1 neurons were performed. The ictal-like discharges induced by Mg2+-free artificial cerebrospinal fluid and N-methyl-D-aspartate were blocked by incubation with JSTX-3. This effect was similar to that obtained with the N-methyl-D-aspartate receptor antagonist DL (-)2-amino-5 phosphonovaleric acid. Our findings suggest that in human hippocampal neuronsVIRGULA the antiepileptic effect of JSTX-3 is mediated by its action on N-methyl-D-aspartate receptor. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Isolation and chemical characterization of PwTx-II: a novel alkaloid toxin from the venom of the spider Parawixia bistriata (AraneidaeVIRGULA Araneae)
column5: [Inglês] Brazil has many species of spiders belonging to Araneidae family howeverVIRGULA very little is known about the compositionVIRGULA chemical structure and mechanisms of action of the main venom components of these spiders. The main objective of this work was to isolate and to perform the chemical characterization of a novel BETA-carboline toxin from the venom of the spider Parawixia bistriataVIRGULA a typical species of the Brazilian 'cerrado'. The toxin was purified by RP-HPLC and structurally elucidated by using a combination of different spectroscopic techniques (UVVIRGULA ESI-MS/MS and 1H NMR)VIRGULA which permitted the assignment of the molecular structure of a novel spider venom toxinVIRGULA identified as 1-4-guanidinobutoxy-6-hydroxy-1VIRGULA2VIRGULA3VIRGULA4-tetrahydro-BETA-carbolineVIRGULA and referred to here as PwTx-II. This compound is toxic to insects (LD50=12+-3 ng/mg honeybee)VIRGULA neurotoxicVIRGULA convulsive and lethal to rats (LD50=9.75 mg/kg of male Wistar rat). (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Antiepileptic effect of acylpolyaminetoxin JSTX-3 on rat hippocampal CA1 neurons in vitro
column5: [Inglês] The Joro spider toxin (JSTX-3)VIRGULA derived from Nephila clavataVIRGULA has been found to block glutamate excitatory activity. Epilepsy has been studied in vitroVIRGULA mostly on rat hippocampusVIRGULA through brain slices techniques. The aim of this study is to verify the effect of the JSTX-3 on the epileptiform activity induced by magnesium-free medium in rat CA1 hippocampal neurons. Experiments were performed on hippocampus slices of control and pilocarpine-treated Wistar ratsVIRGULA prepared and maintained in vitro. Epileptiform activity was induced through omission of magnesium from the artificial cerebrospinal fluid (0-Mg2+ ACSF) superfusate and iontophoretic application of N-methyl-d-aspartate (NMDA). Intracellular recordings were obtained from CA1 pyramidal neurons both of control and epileptic rats. Passive membrane properties were analyzed before and after perfusion with the 0-Mg2+ ACSF and the application of toxin JSTX-3. During the ictal-like activityVIRGULA the toxin JSTX-3 was applied by pressure ejectionVIRGULA abolishing this activity. This effect was completely reversed during the washout period when the slices were formerly perfused with artificial cerebrospinal fluid (ACSF) and again with 0-Mg2+ ACSF. Our results suggest that the toxin JSTX-3 is a potent blocker of induced epileptiform activity. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] A natural combinatorial chemistry strategy in acylppolyamines toxins
column5: [Inglês] The present study shows how nature combined a small number of chemical building blocks to synthesize the acylpolyamine toxins in the venoms of Nephilinae orb-web spiders. Considering these structures in four partsVIRGULA it was possible to rationalize a way to represent the natural combinatorial chemistry involved in the synthesis of these toxins: an aromatic moiety is connected through a linker amino acid to a polyamine chainVIRGULA which in turn may be connected to an optional tail. The polyamine chains were classified into seven subtypes (from A to G) depending on the way the small chemical blocks are combined. These polyamine chains may be connected to one of the three possible chromophore moieties: 2VIRGULA4-dihydroxyphenyl acetic acidVIRGULA or 4-hydroxyindole acetic acidVIRGULA or even with the indole acetic group. The connectivity between the aryl moiety and the polyamine chain is usually made through an asparagine residuePONTOCOMMA optionally a tail may be attached to the polyamine chainPONTOCOMMA nine different types of tails were identified among the 72 known acylpolyamine toxin structures. The combinations of three chromophoresVIRGULA two types of amino acid linkersVIRGULA seven sub-types of polyamine backboneVIRGULA and nine options of tails results in 378 different structural possibilities. HoweverVIRGULA we detected only 91 different toxin structuresVIRGULA which may represent the most successful structural trials in terms of efficiency of prey paralysis/death. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Structure determination of hydroxytrypargine: a new tetrahydro-beta-carboline toxin from the venom of the spider Parawixia bistriata
column5: [Inglês] A newVIRGULA highly active tetrahydro-BETA-carboline toxin from the spider Parawixia bistriataVIRGULA the most-common species of social spider occurring in BrazilVIRGULA was isolated. The new toxin was identified as 1VIRGULA2VIRGULA3VIRGULA4-tetrahydro-6-hydroxy-BETA-carboline (=N-[3-(2VIRGULA3VIRGULA4VIRGULA9-tetrahydro-6-hydroxy-1H-pyrido[3VIRGULA4-b]indol-1-yl)propyl]guanidinePONTOCOMMA 3). This type of alkaloidVIRGULA not common among spider toxinsVIRGULA was found to be the most-potent constituent of the spider's chemical weaponry to kill prey. When P. bistriata catch arthropods in their webVIRGULA they apparently attack their prey in groups of many individuals injecting their venoms. In vivo toxicity assays with 3 demonstrated a potent lethal effect to honeybeesVIRGULA giving rise to clear neurotoxic effects (paralysis) before death. The compound's toxicity (LD50 value) was determined to be ca. 8 ng/g of honeybee. The investigation of the pharmacological properties and neurotoxic actions of 3 may be used in the future for the development of new drugs to be applied for pest control in agriculture. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Role of intermediary cells in Peltodon radicans (Lamiaceae) in the transfer of calcium and formation of calcium oxalate crystals
column5: [Português] Com o objetivo de estudar a relação entre cristais de oxalato de cálcio e floemaVIRGULA fragmentos de folhas de Peltodon radicans foram fixados e processadosVIRGULA segundo métodos usuaisVIRGULA para estudos ao microscópio de luz e eletrônico de transmissão. Observou-se que os cristais ocorrem nas células da bainha do feixeVIRGULA lateralmente em relação ao floema. Células intermediárias estabelecem conexão entre elemento crivado e células da bainhaVIRGULA portadoras de cristaisVIRGULA com crescimento intrusivo entre estas. Íons cálcio são abundantes no citoplasma das células da bainha que contém cristais de oxalato de cálcio. Nas células intermediárias a detecção ultra-citoquímica de cálcio também apresentou resultados positivosVIRGULA enquanto nos elementos crivados a presença deste íon não foi constatada. HáVIRGULA portantoVIRGULA um gradiente crescente de concentração de cálcio dos elementos crivados para as células da bainha. AssimVIRGULA formulamos a hipótese de que a formação de cristais de oxalato de cálcio temVIRGULA em P. radicansVIRGULA o objetivo de controlar os níveis de cálcio citossólico nos elementos crivados. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] With the objective of studying the connection between calcium oxalate crystals formation and the phloemVIRGULA fragments of leaves of Peltodon radicans Pohl (Lamiaceae) were fixed and processedVIRGULA for light and electron-transmission microscopes. It was observed that the crystals occurred in the cells of the bundle sheathVIRGULA juxtaposed in relation to the phloem. Intermediary cells established a connection between the sieve element and crystal-bearing sheath cells. Calcium was present abundantly in the cytoplasm of sheath cells as calcium oxalate crystals. The presence of calcium was also detected in the intermediary cellsVIRGULA but in the sieve elements it was not detected. There wasVIRGULA thereforeVIRGULA an increasing concentration gradient of calcium in the sieve elements from sheath cells. ThusVIRGULA we hypothesized that the formation of calcium oxalate crystals regulates calcium levels in the sieve elements. (AU)

column4: [Português] Diversidade e flutuação populacional de ácaros (Acari) em Mabea fistulifera Mart. (Euphorbiaceae) de dois fragmentos de mata estacional semidecídua em São José do Rio PretoVIRGULA SPVIRGULA [Inglês] Diversity and fluctuation of mites population (Acari) on Mabea fistulifera Mart. (Euphorbiceae) in two semideciduous forest remnants in São José do Rio PretoVIRGULA State of São PauloVIRGULA Brazil
column5: [Português] Amostrou-se mensalmenteVIRGULA durante 2001VIRGULA ácaros de Mabea fistulifera Mart. em dois fragmentos de mataVIRGULA um urbano e outro rural. Em cada local e coletaVIRGULA foram coletadas 20 folhas de cada um de três exemplares de M. fistulifera. As folhas foram examinadas sob estereomicroscópio e todos os ácaros encontradosVIRGULA montados em lâminas e identificados e contados sob microscópio com contraste de fase. A diversidade e a uniformidade de espécies foram analisadas através dos índices de Shannon-Wiener e PielouVIRGULA respectivamente. O índice de similaridade de Morisita-Horn foi utilizado para determinar o grau de semelhança entre as áreas. A diversidade máxima teórica e a constância também foram determinadas. O índice de correlação de Pearson foi utilizado para verificar possíveis relações entre a abundância de ácaros com a pluviosidade. No fragmento urbano foram coletados 6326 ácaros pertencentes a 31 espéciesVIRGULA e no ruralVIRGULA 2330 ácaros de 25 espécies. Nos dois fragmentosVIRGULA a diversidade excedeu 50% da diversidade máxima teóricaVIRGULA entretantoVIRGULA no rural verificou-se maior diversidade. Registrou-se tambémVIRGULA grande abundância de fitófagosVIRGULA que foi maior no urbanoVIRGULA provavelmente como resultado do estresse das plantas favorecendo o desenvolvimento dos fitófagos. Alguns predadores apresentaram grande abundância durante a floração de M. fistuliferaVIRGULA provavelmente por utilizarem o pólen como alimento. A maior abundância de Euseius citrifolius Denmark & MumaVIRGULA na estação secaVIRGULA pode estar correlacionada com a maior disponibilidade de pólenVIRGULA e não com a menor pluviosidade do período. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The mites on Mabea fistulifera Mart. in two forest fragmentsVIRGULA urban and ruralVIRGULA were sampled monthly during 2001. For each site and each sampling dateVIRGULA 20 leaves were taken from each one of three trees. The leaves were inspected under dissecting microscope and all mites collected were mounted on slidesVIRGULA identified and counted by using a phase contrast microscope. Diversity and eveness were analyzed using the Shannon-Wiener and Pielou indexVIRGULA respectively. The Morisita-Horn index described similarities between the two sites. The Maximum Theoretical Diversity and Constancy index were also determined. Possible relationships between mite abundance and rainfall were investigated by Pearson correlation. The urban area had 6326 mites belonging to 31 speciesVIRGULA while the rural area had 2330 individuals of 25 species. In both sitesVIRGULA the diversity exceeded 50% of the maximum theoretical diversityVIRGULA butVIRGULA the rural area showed higher diversity. Both sites had abundant phytophagous mitesVIRGULA however the abundance was higher in the urban fragmentVIRGULA as a result of plant stress that created more favorable conditions for phyphagous to develop. Some predaceous showed high abundance when the trees flowered. This occurs because some phytoseiids can use pollen as food. The only significant (negative) correlation was observed between rainfall and the population of Euseius citrifolius Denmark & Muma. HoweverVIRGULA the higher population of E. citrifolius on M. fistulifera in the dry season could be mostly due to the larger abundance of pollen in that period. (AU)

A análise das células mostrou 2n = 24 e 2n = 26 cromossomos nos embriões e 2n = 26 nas células ovarianasVIRGULA sendo todos cromossomos acrocêntricos... (AU)^ptVIRGULA [Inglês] The aim of this work is to characterize Nephilengys cruentata in relation to the diploid numberVIRGULA chromosome morphologyVIRGULA type of sex determination chromosome systemVIRGULA chromosomes bearing the Nucleolar Organizer Regions (NORs)VIRGULA C-banding patternVIRGULA and AT or GC repetitive sequences. The chromosome preparations were submitted to standard staining (Giemsa)VIRGULA NOR silver impregnationVIRGULA C-banding techniqueVIRGULA and base-specific fluorochrome staining. The analysis of the cells showed 2n = 24 and 2n = 26 chromosomes in the embryosVIRGULA and 2n = 26 in the ovarian cellsVIRGULA being all the chromosomes acrocentric... (AU)

column4: [Português] Estratégias e modos reprodutivos de anuros (Amphibia) em uma poça permanente na serra de ParanapiacabaVIRGULA sudeste do BrasilVIRGULA [Inglês] Strategies and reproductive modes of anurans (Amphibia) in a permanent pond in serra de ParanapiacabaVIRGULA southeastern Brazil
column5: [Português] Este estudo descreve o padrão temporalVIRGULA as estratégias reprodutivasVIRGULA os modos reprodutivos e a fecundidade de uma taxocenose de anuros em uma poça permanente na Serra de ParanapiacabaVIRGULA município de Ribeirão BrancoVIRGULA sul do estado de São Paulo (aproximadamente 24º13'SPONTOCOMMA 48º46'WPONTOCOMMA ca. 800m do nível do mar). O Trabalho de campo foi conduzido entre janeiro e dezembro de 1993VIRGULA totalizando 40 noites de observações. Sete visitas preliminares foram feitas antes deste período e sete após. Observações naturalísticas normalmente se iniciavam antes do pôr do sol e eram concluídas aproximadamente entre 24:0001:00h. Em três ocasiões as observações foram ao longo da noite. A estratégia reprodutiva mais comum entre os machos de diferentes espécies foi a do macho cantorVIRGULA mas comportamento satélite foi observado em algumas espécies. O padrão temporal foi prolongado para as espécies desta taxocenosePONTOCOMMA entretantoVIRGULA algumas espécies podiam vocalizar ocasionalmente. Seis diferentes modos reprodutivos foram observados na poça ou suas margens. O comprimento rostro-cloacal (CRC) das fêmeas de diferentes espécies foi positivamente correlacionado com o volume da desovaVIRGULA independente do modo reprodutivo. O CRC das fêmeas foi positivamente correlacionado com o número de ovos por desovaVIRGULA embora a correlação seja mais forte para espécies com um modo reprodutivo generalizado. EntretantoVIRGULA para espécies com modo reprodutivo especializado o número de ovos por desova não foi correlacionado com o CRC das fêmeas. Uma correlação positiva e significativa entre o CRC das fêmeas e o diâmetro dos ovosVIRGULA também foi detectada para espécies com modo reprodutivo generalizado. Por outro ladoVIRGULA para as espécies com modo reprodutivo especializado o CRC das fêmeas e o diâmetro dos ovos foram negativamente correlacionados. Modos reprodutivos terrestres são possivelmente restritos a espécies pequenas. Ovos grandes podem apresentar problemas com a troca de gases devido ao seu longo desenvolvimento e baixa relação superfície/volume. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Strategies and reproductive modes of anurans (Amphibia) in a permanent pond in Serra de ParanapiacabaVIRGULA southeastern Brazil. This study describes the temporal patternsVIRGULA behavioral strategiesVIRGULA reproductive modesVIRGULA and fecundity of an anuran assemblage in a permanent pond in Serra de ParanapiacabaVIRGULA municipality of Ribeirão BrancoVIRGULA south of São Paulo State (approximately 24º13'SPONTOCOMMA 48º46'WPONTOCOMMA ca. 800m above sea level). Field work was carried out between January and December 1993VIRGULA totaling 40 nights of observation. Seven preliminary visits were made before this period and seven additional ones after December 1993. Naturalistic observations usually began before sunset and were concluded around 24:0001:00h. On three occasions the observations lasted the entire night. The commonest reproductive strategy among males of different species was that performed by calling maleVIRGULA but the satellite behavior was observed in some species. The calling temporal pattern was prolonged for the species of the assemblagePONTOCOMMA howeverVIRGULA some species called only occasionally. Six different reproductive modes were observed in the pond or on its margins. The SVL of females of different species was positively correlated with egg clutch volumeVIRGULA irrespective of the reproductive mode. The SVL of females was also positively correlated with the number of eggs per clutchVIRGULA although the correlation is stronger for species with a generalized reproductive mode. HoweverVIRGULA for species with specialized reproductive mode the number of eggs per clutch was not correlated with the SVL of females. A significant and positive correlation between female SVL and egg diameter was also detected for species with generalized reproductive mode. On the other handVIRGULA for species with specialized reproductive modeVIRGULA female's SVL and egg diameter were negatively correlated. Terrestrial reproductive modes are possibly restricted to small-sized species. Large eggs may face problems of gas exchange due to their longer development period and lower surface/volume ratio. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Diet of the lizard Mabuya agilis (SauriaPONTOCOMMA Scincidae) in an insular habitat (Ilha GrandeVIRGULA RJVIRGULA Brazil)VIRGULA [Português] Dieta do lagarto Mabuya agilis (SauriaPONTOCOMMA Scincidae) em um habitat insular (Ilha GrandeVIRGULA RJVIRGULA Brasil)
column5: [Português] Examinamos os conteúdos dos estômagos de 21 espécimes de Mabuya agilis (SauriaPONTOCOMMA Scincidae) coletados em fevereiro de 2001 no habitat de restinga de Praia do SulVIRGULA na Ilha GrandeVIRGULA RJVIRGULA Brasil. A dieta estava composta de vários tipos de artrópodes pequenosVIRGULA sem consumo de material vegetal. Aranhas foram os itens mais importantes na dietaVIRGULA seguidos por ortópteros. Exceto pela ausência de isópterosVIRGULA a dieta de Mabuya agilis dessa área insular foi semelhante à de outras populações continentais coespecíficas. Isto sugere que fatores como a insularidade e a ausência de outros pequenos lagartos simpátricos podem não ter efeito significativo nos hábitos alimentares da população de Praia do Sul. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] We examined the stomach contents of 21 specimens of Mabuya agilis (SauriaPONTOCOMMA Scincidae) collected during February 2001 at the restinga habitat of Praia do SulVIRGULA in Ilha GrandeVIRGULA RJVIRGULA Brazil. Diet was composed of various types of small arthropodsVIRGULA with no plant material being eaten. Spiders were the most important items in the dietVIRGULA followed by orthopterans. Apart from the absence of isopteransVIRGULA the diet of Mabuya agilis from this insular area was similar to those of other conspecific mainland populations. This suggests that factors such as insularity and the absence of other small sympatric lizards may not have a significant effect on the feeding habits of the Praia do Sul population. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Cytogenetics of the Brazilian whiptail lizard Cnemidophorus littoralis (Teiidae) from a restinga area (Barra de Maricá) in Southeastern BrazilVIRGULA [Português] Citogenética de Cnemidophorus littoralis (Teiidae) da restinga da Barra de Maricá no Sudeste do Brasil
column5: [Inglês] Chromosomes of Cnemidophorus littoralisVIRGULA a new species of teiid lizard recently describedVIRGULA were studied. The animals are from a restinga area in Barra de MaricáVIRGULA RJ. The karyotype presents a diploid number of 2n = 46 chromosomes and a chromosomal sex determination mechanism of the type XX:XY. Nucleolar organizer regionsVIRGULA Ag-NORsVIRGULA are at the sixth pair of chromosomesPONTOCOMMA there is variability of size and number of the Ag-stained nucleoli on the 50 interphase nuclei for each specimen analyzed. These nucleoli are related to NOR patterns that also demonstrated variability in size and number. This paper presents the first description of the karyotype of Cnemidophorus littoralis and of a chromosomal sex determination mechanism of the XX:XY type in the genus Cnemidophorus from Southeastern Brazil. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Estudamos os cromossomos de Cnemidophorus littoralisVIRGULA uma nova espécie de lagarto recentemente descritaVIRGULA pertencente à família Teiidae. Os animais são oriundos de uma população de restinga na Barra de MaricáVIRGULA RJ. O cariótipo apresenta número diplóide 2n = 46 cromossomosVIRGULA com mecanismo cromossômico de determinação do sexo do tipo XX:XY. As regiões organizadoras do nucléoloVIRGULA Ag-RONsVIRGULA estão no sexto par de cromossomos. Analisamos 50 núcleos interfásicos corados pela prata para cada exemplar e observamos variação quanto ao número e ao tamanho de nucléolosPONTOCOMMA estes estão relacionados aos padrões RONsVIRGULA que também apresentaram variação quanto ao tamanho e ao número. Este trabalho também descreve pela primeira vez a presença de um mecanismo de determinação cromossômica do sexo para o gênero Cnemidophorus do Sudeste do Brasil. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Natural history of the lizard Enyalius brasiliensis (LessonVIRGULA 1828) (Leiosauridae) from an Atlantic Forest of southeastern BrazilVIRGULA [Português] História natural do lagarto Enyalius brasiliensis (LessonVIRGULA 1828) (Leiosauridae) em área de Mata Atlântica do Sudeste do Brasil
column5: [Português] Informações sobre a ecologia de espécies de lagartos da Floresta Atlântica brasileira são raras. Quase nada é conhecido sobre a ecologia de lagartos do gênero Enyalius. Com este estudo fornecemos informações sobre alguns aspectos da história natural de E. brasiliensis de uma área de Mata Atlântica da Ilha GrandeVIRGULA RJ. Os indivíduos de E. brasiliensis (N = 15) se alimentaram principalmente de artrópodos. As presas ingeridas com maior freqüência foram larvas de insetosVIRGULA ortópteros e formigasPONTOCOMMA em termos volumétricosVIRGULA larvas e cupins foram os itens mais importantesPONTOCOMMA e formigas e cupins foram as presas mais numerosas. Das 10 fêmeas encontradasVIRGULA duas estavam reprodutivas (uma tinha 10 e a outraVIRGULA 5 folículos vitelogênicos)PONTOCOMMA a menor delas media 92VIRGULA4 mm de tamanho corporal. Sete dos 15 lagartos foram encontrados sobre folhiço no chão da mata. Os outros micro-habitats utilizados foram cipósVIRGULA troncos caídosVIRGULA galhos e um barranco de terra dentro de uma fenda de rocha. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Information on the ecology of lizard species from the Brazilian Atlantic Forest is scarce and almost nothing is known about the ecology of lizards of the genus Enyalius. In this studyVIRGULA we provide information about some aspects of the natural history of E. brasiliensis from an area of Atlantic Forest in Ilha GrandeVIRGULA RJ. Enyalius brasiliensis (N = 15) feeds mainly on arthropods. The most frequent food items were insect larvaeVIRGULA orthopteransVIRGULA and antsPONTOCOMMA in terms of volumeVIRGULA larvae and termites were the most important food itemsPONTOCOMMA ants and termites were the most numerous prey categories. Two females were reproductive (one had 10 and the otherVIRGULA five vitellogenic follicles)PONTOCOMMA the smallest measured 92.4 mm in SVL. Seven lizards were found on forest leaf litter. The other microhabitats used were vinesVIRGULA fallen logsVIRGULA branchesVIRGULA and a crevice on a slope. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Ichthyofauna of two streams (silted and reference) in the Upper Paraná river basinVIRGULA southeastern BrazilVIRGULA [Português] Ictiofauna de dois riachos (assoreado e referência) na bacia do Alto Rio ParanáVIRGULA sudeste do Brasil
column5: [Inglês] In this study the fish assemblages of the silted Águas Claras stream (AC) was compared with that of a referenceVIRGULA the São Carlos stream (SC)VIRGULA so as to identify potential fish indicators of integrity or degradation. Both streamsVIRGULA located about 5 km from one anotherVIRGULA are part of the Upper Paraná river basinVIRGULA BrazilVIRGULA and present similar physiographical features. Twenty-one species were collected in AC (1VIRGULA271 specimens) and 18 in SC (940 specimens). In ACVIRGULA dominant species e.g.VIRGULA Corydoras aeneus (sandy pools)VIRGULA Serrapinnus notomelasVIRGULA and Pyrrhulina australis (warm marginal shallow pools) were those favored by new microhabitats linked to siltation and removal of the riparian vegetation. Changes in the composition of the marginal vegetation resulted in dominance of species such as Hisonotus francirochai (marginal grasses). In SC the dominant species was Phalloceros caudimacultusVIRGULA abundant in marginal shallow poolsVIRGULA and Trichomycterus diabolus. and Hypostomus nigromaculatusVIRGULA exclusively riffle-dwelling speciesVIRGULA which were absent in AC. Fish assemblage monitoring is recommended for use in riparian management programs in order to evaluate negative instream sedimentation effects. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Neste trabalhoVIRGULA a ictiofauna de um riacho assoreado (córrego Águas Claras - AC) foi comparada com a de um riacho referência (córrego São Carlos - SC)VIRGULA com o objetivo de identificar espécies potencialmente indicadoras de integridade ou degradação. Os riachos localizam-se na bacia do Alto Rio ParanáVIRGULA BrasilVIRGULA estão distantes cerca de 5 km entre si e apresentam características fisiográficas semelhantes. Foram coletadas 21 espécies no AC (1.271 indivíduos) e 18 no SC (940 indivíduos). No ACVIRGULA as espécies dominantes foram aquelas favorecidas por microhabitats relacionados ao assoreamento e à remoção da vegetação marginalVIRGULA como Corydoras aeneus (poços de fundo de areia)VIRGULA Serrapinnus notomelas e Pyrrhulina australis (poços rasos marginais)VIRGULA e por alterações na vegetação marginalVIRGULA como Hisonotus francirochai (bancos de gramíneas marginais). No SCVIRGULA a espécie mais abundante foi Phalloceros caudimaculatusVIRGULA freqüentemente encontrada em poços rasos marginaisVIRGULA seguida por Trichomycterus diabolus e Hypostomus nigromaculatusVIRGULA exclusivamente encontradas em corredeiras e queVIRGULA em contrasteVIRGULA não foram registradas no AC. Recomenda-se o monitoramento das comunidades de peixes em programas de recuperação de vegetação ripária para que sejam avaliados os efeitos do assoreamento sobre essas comunidades. (AU)

column5: [Inglês] Eighteen 100 m long streams stretchesVIRGULA none of an order higher than threeVIRGULA were sampled in three tributaries (six stream stretches sampled in each one) of the left margin of the main channel of Rio Grande (Rios TurvoVIRGULA Pardo and Sapucaí) in the State of São PauloVIRGULA southeastern Brazil. Each stream stretch had its midpoint located with a GPS satellite receiver and had its fish fauna sampled via a standardized environmental data and fish collection methodology (primarily utilizing electrofishing) with the aim of providing the following information about each stream: 1) the taxonomic composition of the fish fauna and the contribution of each species in that stream in terms of both number of individuals and biomassPONTOCOMMA 2) a photographic documentation of the live coloration of representative specimens of each collected speciesPONTOCOMMA and 3) the description of each sampled environmentVIRGULA with colored photographic illustrations and details of the main biotic and abiotic parameters. Overall 3VIRGULA070 fishes were collectedVIRGULA belonging to six ordersVIRGULA 18 familiesVIRGULA 44 generaVIRGULA and 64 speciesVIRGULA with a total biomass of 14.3 kg. Of the collected speciesVIRGULA approximately 50% were CharaciformesVIRGULA 26.5% SiluriformesVIRGULA 11% PerciformesVIRGULA 6% GymnotiformesVIRGULA 5% CyprinodontiformesVIRGULA and 1.5% Synbranchiformes. The most abundant species in terms of total number of individuals were Astyanax altiparanae (17.4%) and Hypostomus ancistroides (9%)PONTOCOMMA the species with the largest biomasses were Astyanax altiparanae (35%) and Geophagus brasiliensis (9%). In terms of abundance and biomass collected for each familyVIRGULA the Characidae was clearly the predominant family followed by the LoricariidaeVIRGULA and Cichlidae. Among the sampled stream stretchesVIRGULA locality SG6 with 26 species and locality PG4 with three species yielded the highest and lowest richness in terms of species numbersVIRGULA respectively. This coincides with the values obtained for the Shannon- Wiener index of specific diversity (H´ = 1.08 and 0.26VIRGULA respectively). The median species richness for all streams stretches was 12. In the species richness estimate by extrapolation for all 18 sampled stream stretchesVIRGULA a value of 93 species was obtained (with a standard error of three) indicating the need for an additional moderate sampling effort to reach the asymptote of the curve. Of the 64 collected speciesVIRGULA four (approximately 6% of the total) are clearly new to science and seven other species (approximately 11% of the total) are of indefinite taxonomic status and require further analysis. Two of the captured species are certainly introduced (approximately 3% of the total). Analysis of the trophic and spatial structure of the studied fish fauna indicates that the 10 numerically dominant species in the sampled streams can be groupedVIRGULA based on published dataVIRGULA into five guilds that are in decreasing order of numeric importance: nektonic omnivoresPONTOCOMMA benthic invertivoresPONTOCOMMA periphytovoresPONTOCOMMA algivores and benthic omnivores... (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Foram amostrados 18 trechos de riachos com 100 m de extensãoVIRGULA todos de ordem igual ou menor a trêsVIRGULA em três tributários (Rios TurvoVIRGULA Pardo e Sapucaí) da margem esquerda do canal principal do Rio Grande (seis trechos de riacho por tributário)VIRGULA São Paulo. O ponto médio de cada trecho foi georreferenciado via satélite com receptor GPS e o uso de metodologia padronizada de coleta de dados ambientais e peixes (baseada principalmente na pesca elétrica)VIRGULA possibilitou a obtenção das seguintes informações em cada local: 1) composição taxonômica da ictiofauna e contribuiçãoVIRGULA em termos de número de indivíduos e biomassaVIRGULA de cada espécie para a ictiofauna local como um todoPONTOCOMMA 2) documentação fotográfica de espécimes representativos de cada espécie coletada com sua coloração naturalPONTOCOMMA 3) descrição de cada ambiente coletadoVIRGULA com ilustrações fotográficas coloridasVIRGULA e seus principais parâmetros bióticos e abióticos. No total foram coletados 3.070 exemplaresVIRGULA pertencentes a seis ordensVIRGULA 18 famíliasVIRGULA 44 gêneros e 64 espéciesVIRGULA com biomassa total de 14VIRGULA3 kg. Das espécies coletadasVIRGULA aproximadamente 50% pertencem a ordem CharaciformesVIRGULA 26VIRGULA5% a SiluriformesVIRGULA 11% a PerciformesVIRGULA 6% a GymnotiformesVIRGULA 5% a Cyprinodontiformes e 1VIRGULA5% a Synbranchiformes. As espécies mais abundantes em termos de número de indivíduos foram Astyanax altiparanae (17VIRGULA4%) e Hypostomus ancistroides (9%)PONTOCOMMA aquelas com maior biomassa foram A. altiparanae (35%) e Geophagus brasiliensis (9%). Em termos de abundância e biomassa por famíliaVIRGULA a composição da fauna de peixes estudada indica a predominância expressiva de CharacidaeVIRGULA seguida por Loricariidae e Cichlidae. Dentre os trechos amostradosVIRGULA o trecho SG6 (26 espécies) e o PG4 (três espécies)VIRGULA apresentaram a maior e a menor riqueza em espéciesVIRGULA respectivamenteVIRGULA coincidindo com os valores obtidos para o índice de diversidade específica de Shannon-Wiener (H´= 1VIRGULA08 e 0VIRGULA26VIRGULA respectivamente). A riqueza média encontrada foi de 12 espécies por trecho de riacho. Na estimativa de riqueza por extrapolação para o conjunto total de riachos amostrados na bacia do Rio GrandeVIRGULA obtivemos um valor de 93 espécies (erro padrão igual a três) indicando ser necessário um esforço amostral adicional moderado para atingir a assíntota da curva. Das 64 espécies coletadasVIRGULA quatro (aproximadamente 6% do total) são seguramente novasVIRGULA sete (aproximadamente 11% do total) possuem status taxonômico ainda indefinidoVIRGULA enquanto outras duas (aproximadamente 3% do total) são espécies certamente introduzidas. Analisando a estrutura trófica e espacial da ictiofauna estudada as 10 espécies numericamente dominantes nos riachos amostrados dividem-seVIRGULA com base em dados de literaturaVIRGULA em ordem decrescente de importância numéricaVIRGULA em cinco guildas: onívoros nectônicosPONTOCOMMA invertívoros bentônicosPONTOCOMMA perifitívorosPONTOCOMMA algívoros e onívoros bentônicos. Uma chave de identificação para todas as espécies de peixes coletadas durante este estudo é fornecida ao final deste trabalho. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Fish assemblage structure in a first order streamVIRGULA southeastern Brazil: longitudinal distributionVIRGULA seasonalityVIRGULA and microhabitat diversity
column5: [Português] Este estudo foi conduzido em três trechos - superiorVIRGULA médio e inferior - de um riacho de primeira ordem no Parque Estadual Morro do DiaboVIRGULA sudeste do Brasil. Observações subaquáticas a partir de mergulho livre e coletas foram realizadas na estação seca (junho e setembro de 2000) e chuvosa (dezembro de 2000 e março de 2001). Das 16 espécies documentadasVIRGULA 11 foram residentes ao longo das observações. Phalloceros caudimaculatusVIRGULA Hypostomus nigromaculatusVIRGULA Hisonotus francirochaiVIRGULA Trichomycterus diabolus e Hypostomus ancistroides representaram 90% do total de indivíduos amostrados. A maior riqueza e abundância ocorreram durante a estação chuvosa. Em geralVIRGULA a adição longitudinal de espécies seguiu a adição de micro-hábitats. Indivíduos sexualmente maduros foram encontrados ao longo do ano para a maioria das espéciesVIRGULA o que sugere prolongada atividade reprodutiva. ContudoVIRGULA visto que a maioria dos jovens foi coletada na estação chuvosaVIRGULA é provável que neste período ocorra um incremento de atividade reprodutivaVIRGULA em razão de maior disponibilidade de recursos críticosVIRGULA principalmente abrigos e alimentos. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] This study was carried out on a first order stream in the Morro do Diabo State ParkVIRGULA southeastern Brazil. Three equidistant stream stretches - upperVIRGULA middleVIRGULA and lower - were chosen for underwater observations and fish collections that were performed in the dry (June and September 2000) and wet seasons (December 2000 and March 2001). Of the 18 fish species documentedVIRGULA 11 were considered resident year round. Phalloceros caudimaculatusVIRGULA Hypostomus nigromaculatusVIRGULA Hisonotus francirochaiVIRGULA Trichomycterus diabolusVIRGULA and Hypostomus ancistroides represented 90% of the collected specimens. The highest richness and abundance occurred during the wet season. In generalVIRGULA the longitudinal addition of species follows the addition of microhabitats. Sexually mature individuals were present throughout the year for the majority of the speciesVIRGULA which suggests broad reproductive activity. HoweverVIRGULA given that most juveniles specimens were collected during the wet seasonVIRGULA it is hypothesized that reproduction and survival rates must be higher during this season due to higher availability of critical resourcesVIRGULA most probably food and shelter. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Review of the Bufo crucifer species groupVIRGULA with descriptions of two new related species (AmphibiaVIRGULA AnuraVIRGULA Bufonidae)
column5: [Português] O grupo de Bufo crucifer é revisado com base em caracteres morfológicos externos e morfométricosVIRGULA evidenciando variação em tamanhoVIRGULA forma das glândulas parotóidesVIRGULA largura da cabeçaVIRGULA cristas cefálicas e presença ou ausência de manchas amarelas próximo à cloaca e nas pernas. Cinco espécies são reconhecidas: Bufo crucifer Wied-NeuwiedVIRGULA 1821VIRGULA B. ornatus SpixVIRGULA 1824 (revalidada)VIRGULA B. henseli A.LutzVIRGULA 1924 (revalidada)VIRGULA B. abei sp.nov. e B. pombali sp.nov. A distribuição geográfica das espécies é associada à Floresta Atlântica e regiões adjacentes: B. crucifer ocorre do estado do Ceará ao sul do estado do Espírito Santo e nordeste do estado de Minas GeraisPONTOCOMMA B. ornatus ocorre do sul do estado do Espírito SantoVIRGULA através dos estados do Rio de Janeiro e São Paulo até o norte do estado do Paraná e possivelmente no nordeste da ArgentinaVIRGULA nas Províncias Misiones e CorrientesPONTOCOMMA B. henseli é encontrada do sul do estado de Santa Catarina até a região costeira do estado do Rio Grande do SulPONTOCOMMA B. abei sp.nov.VIRGULA descrita de Córrego GrandeVIRGULA município de FlorianópolisVIRGULA estado de Santa CatarinaVIRGULA está distribuída do estado do Paraná até o sul do estado de Santa Catarina e áreas do norte do estado do Rio Grande do SulPONTOCOMMA B. pombali sp.nov.VIRGULA descrita da Reserva Biológica de PetiVIRGULA município de São Gonçalo do Rio AbaixoVIRGULA estado de Minas GeraisVIRGULA ocorre nas áreas de transição entre a Floresta Atlântica e os cerrados no estado de Minas Gerais. AdicionalmenteVIRGULA Bufo crucifer var. pfrimeri Miranda-RibeiroVIRGULA 1926VIRGULA atualmente incluída na sinonimia de B. cruciferVIRGULA é transferida para a sinonimia de Bufo guttatus SchneiderVIRGULA 1799. Bufo levicristatus BoettgerVIRGULA 1885 é considerada species inquirenda e retirada da sinonimia de qualquer das espécies incluídas no grupo de B. crucifer. Bufo spixii FitzingerVIRGULA 1826 é transferida da sinonimia de Bufo margaritifer (LaurentiVIRGULA 1768) para a sinonimia de Bufo ornatus SpixVIRGULA 1824. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The Bufo crucifer species group is revised on the basis of external morphological and morphometrical characteristicsVIRGULA evidencing variation in sizeVIRGULA shape of the parotoid glandVIRGULA width of the headVIRGULA cranial crestsVIRGULA and presence or absence of yellow spots near the cloaca and hind limbs. Five species are recognized: B. crucifer Wied-NeuwiedVIRGULA 1821VIRGULA B. ornatus SpixVIRGULA 1824 (revalidated)VIRGULA B. henseli A.LutzVIRGULA 1934 (revalidated)VIRGULA B. abei sp.nov.VIRGULA and B. pombali sp.nov. The geographic distribution of the species is associated with the Atlantic Rain Forest and adjacent areas: B. crucifer occurs from the State of Ceará to southern State of Espírito Santo and northeastern State of Minas GeraisPONTOCOMMA B. ornatus is distributed from southern State of Espírito SantoVIRGULA through the states of Rio de Janeiro and São Paulo to northern State of ParanáVIRGULA and possibly in northeastern ArgentinaVIRGULA in the provinces Misiones and CorrientesPONTOCOMMA B. henseli is found from southern State of Santa Catarina to the coast of the State of Rio Grande do SulPONTOCOMMA B. abei sp.nov.VIRGULA described from Córrego GrandeVIRGULA Municipality of FlorianópolisVIRGULA State of Santa CatarinaVIRGULA is distributed from the State of Paraná to southern State of Santa Catarina and areas of the northern State of Rio Grande do SulPONTOCOMMA and B. pombali sp.nov.VIRGULA described from the Reserva Biológica de PetiVIRGULA Municipality of São Gonçalo do Rio AbaixoVIRGULA State of Minas GeraisVIRGULA occurs in transitional areas between the Atlantic Rain Forest and the cerrados in the State of Minas Gerais. AdditionallyVIRGULA Bufo crucifer var. pfrimeri Miranda-RibeiroVIRGULA 1926VIRGULA currently in the synonymy of B. cruciferVIRGULA is transfered to the synonymy of Bufo guttatus SchneiderVIRGULA 1799. Bufo levicristatus BoettgerVIRGULA 1885 is considered a species inquirenda and removed from the synonymy of any species included in the B. crucifer group. Bufo spixii FitzingerVIRGULA 1826 is transfered from the synonymy of Bufo margaritifer (LaurentiVIRGULA 1768) to the synonymy of Bufo ornatus SpixVIRGULA 1824. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Experimental infestation with the immatures of Amblyomma dissimile KochVIRGULA 1844 (Acari: Ixodidae) on Tropidurus torquatus (Lacertilia: Iguanidae) and Oryctolagus cuniculusVIRGULA [Português] Infestação experimental com as fases imaturas de Amblyomma dissimile KochVIRGULA 1844 (Acari: Ixodidae) em Tropidurus torquatus (Lacertilia: Iguanidae) e Oryctolagus cuniculus
column5: [Português] Larvas provenientes de duas fêmeas de Amblyomma dissimile KochVIRGULA 1844 (Acari: Ixodidae)VIRGULA naturalmente ingurgitadas em uma iguana (Iguana iguana) e provenientes do estado do Mato GrossoVIRGULA foram utilizadas na infestação experimental de lagartos da espécie Tropidurus torquatus e coelhos domésticos. As larvas alimentadas em ambos os hospedeiros realizaram ecdise para ninfas. As ninfas apenas ingurgitaram no lagarto e mudaram para machos e fêmeas. Este é o primeiro registro do parasitismo de larvas e ninfas de A. dissimile em T. torquatus e de larvas em coelhos. (AU)

column4: [Português] Anatomia comparada do pulvinoVIRGULA pecíolo e raque de Pterodon pubescens Benth. (Fabaceae - Faboideae)VIRGULA [Inglês] Comparative anatomy of pulvinusVIRGULA petiole and rachis of Pterodon pubescens Benth. (Fabaceae - Faboideae)
column5: [Português] Em Pterodon pubescensVIRGULA os pulvinos primário e secundárioVIRGULA órgãos responsáveis pelos movimentos foliaresVIRGULA apresentam peculiaridades estruturais em relação ao pecíolo e raque. Estas peculiaridades incluem cutícula mais espessaVIRGULA córtex mais desenvolvido formado por células parenquimáticas de formas variáveisVIRGULA sistema vascular em posição centralVIRGULA floema circundado por fibras septadas não lignificadas e medula parenquimática reduzida ou ausente. Pecíolo e raque apresentam córtex reduzido constituído por células parenquimáticas isodiamétricasVIRGULA sistema vascular periféricoVIRGULA floema envolvido por calota de fibras gelatinosas e medula ampla. Compostos fenólicos foram detectados no vacúolo das células corticais dos pulvinosVIRGULA enquanto que no córtex e medula do pecíolo e da raque foram observados amiloplastos em abundância e ausência de compostos fenólicos. Em geralVIRGULA as características estruturais do pulvino de P. pubescens são comuns aos pulvinos das demais espécies de Fabaceae e têm sido relacionadas com a intensificação de trocas laterais de íons e água entre células do córtex e sistema vascularVIRGULA além de proporcionar maior flexibilidade e capacidade de movimento desta região. Já as características do pecíolo e da raque conferem maior rigidez a estas estruturas foliares. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] In Pterodon pubescens the primary and secondary pulvini show structural peculiarities in relations of petiole and rachis. These peculiarities include thicker cuticuleVIRGULA more developed cortex with only parenchyma cells with irregular shapeVIRGULA central vascular tissuesVIRGULA presence of septate fibers around the phloemVIRGULA and absent or reduced pith. Petiole and rachis show reduced cortex constituted by parenchyma isodiameters cellsVIRGULA peripheric vascular tissues surrounded by gelatinous fibers and pith. Phenolic compounds were detected inside vacuole of parenchyma cells of the pulvinus. Starch grains were observed in the parenchyma cells of petiole and rachis. The features of P. pubescens pulvinus are common to pulvini of others species of FabaceaeVIRGULA and have been associated to the intensification of lateral changes of ion and water between cortical cells and vascular tissuesVIRGULA besides to provide more flexibility and movement capacity of this organ. On the other handVIRGULA the features of petiole and rachis give more rigidity to these leaves structures. (AU)

column4: [Português] Anatomia foliar de Erythroxylum P. Browne (Erythroxylaceae) do cerrado do estado de São PauloVIRGULA BrasilVIRGULA [Inglês] Leaf anatomy of Erythroxylum P. Browne (Erythroxylaceae) from cerrado of the state of São PauloVIRGULA Brazil
column5: [Português] Com o objetivo de apontar caracteres úteis na delimitação taxonômicaVIRGULA foram estudadas as folhas das espécies de Erythroxylum do Cerrado do Estado de São Paulo(E. ambiguumVIRGULA E. campestreVIRGULA E. cuneifoliumVIRGULA E. deciduumVIRGULA E. microphyllumVIRGULA E. nanumVIRGULA E. pelleterianumVIRGULA E. suberosum e E. tortuosum). Todas as folhas são revestidas por cristais de cera epicuticularVIRGULA que apresentam forma de grânulo ou plaquetas e se distribuem de maneira esparsa ou densa. Para todos os representantesVIRGULA o padrão de nervação é camptódromo - broquidódromoVIRGULA o mesofilo é dorsiventral e os estômatos restringem-se à superfície abaxial. Algumas características como bordo acuminadoVIRGULA região da nervura central com projeção adaxialVIRGULA feixes vasculares laterais envolvidos por bainha parenquimática e tecido vascular em forma de arco abertoVIRGULA nos pecíolosVIRGULA são de ampla distribuição nas espécies estudadas. Outras características como bordo arredondadoVIRGULA nervura central com um único feixe vascularVIRGULA epiderme papilosa na face abaxial e ocasionalmente biestratificadaVIRGULA na adaxialVIRGULA além de esclereídes dispersas no mesofiloVIRGULA restringem-se a determinados táxons. A presença ou ausência dos diferentes caracteres foliares permitiu elaborar uma chave de identificação para os Erythroxylum aqui estudados. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] With the aim of pointing out useful character for taxonomic purposesVIRGULA westudied the leaf of the Erythroxylum species that grow on Cerrado vegetation in São Paulo stateVIRGULA Brazil (E. ambiguumVIRGULA E. campestreVIRGULA E. cuneifoliumVIRGULA E. deciduumVIRGULA E. microphyllumVIRGULA E. nanumVIRGULA E. pelleterianumVIRGULA E. suberosum and E. tortuosum). They are all covered by granules or platelets of epicuticular waxes of sparse or dense distribution. The venation is of camptodromous - brochidodromous patternVIRGULA the mesophyll is dorsiventral and the stomata occur only on the abaxial surface. Some featuresVIRGULA such as acuminated marginVIRGULA midrib region with adaxial projectionVIRGULA lateral vascular bundle surrounded by a parenchymatous sheath and petiole with vascular tissue in an opened arc-shapeVIRGULA are widely distributed amongst the studied species. OthersVIRGULA like rounded marginVIRGULA midrib with only one vascular bundleVIRGULA papillose epidermis on the abaxial surfaceVIRGULA and occasionally bi-layered on the adaxial surfaceVIRGULA besides scattered sclereids on the mesophyllVIRGULA occur only in some taxa. The occurrence or not of these leaf features allowed the elaboration of an identification key for the Erythroxylum species. (AU)

column5: [Inglês] Nosferattus gen. nov.VIRGULA Capeta gen. nov. and Amatorculus gen. nov. are proposed from North and Northeastern Brazil. Due to the absence of teeth on the retromargin of the cheliceraeVIRGULA these genera are included within the SitticinaeVIRGULA and are probably related to the genus Aillutticus GalianoVIRGULA 1987VIRGULA with which they share a highVIRGULA broad carapaceVIRGULA rounded laterally behind the posterior lateral eyesVIRGULA and the cephalic region slightly convex. Nosferattus is proposed to include five species: the type species Nosferattus discus sp. nov. and Nosferattus ciliatus sp. nov. from MaranhãoVIRGULA Nosferattus aegis sp. nov. from TocantinsVIRGULA Nosferattus occultus sp. nov. from Maranhão and CearáVIRGULA and Nosferattus palmatus sp. nov. from Sergipe. Capeta and Amatorculus are both monotypic and are proposed to include Capeta tridens sp. nov.VIRGULA from BahiaVIRGULA and Amatorculus stygius sp. nov.VIRGULA from Distrito Federal and São PauloVIRGULA respectively. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Nosferattus gen. nov.VIRGULA Capeta gen. nov. e Amatorculus gen. nov. são propostos para o norte e nordeste do Brasil. Devido à ausência de dentes na retromargem das quelícerasVIRGULA estes gêneros são incluídos entre os SitticinaeVIRGULA e provavelmente estão relacionados ao gênero Aillutticus GalianoVIRGULA 1987VIRGULA com o qual compartilham uma carapaça alta e largaVIRGULA arredondada lateralmente atrás dos olhos laterais posterioresVIRGULA e a região cefálica levemente convexa. Nosferattus é proposto para incluir cinco espécies: a espécie-tipo Nosferattus discus sp. nov. e Nosferattus ciliatus sp. nov. do MaranhãoVIRGULA Nosferattus aegis sp. nov. do TocantinsVIRGULA Nosferattus occultus sp. nov. do Maranhão e do CearáVIRGULA e Nosferattus palmatus sp. nov. de Sergipe. Capeta e Amatorculus são ambos monotípicos e são propostos para incluir Capeta tridens sp. nov.VIRGULA da BahiaVIRGULA e Amatorculus stygius sp. nov.VIRGULA do Distrito Federal e de São PauloVIRGULA respectivamente. (AU)

Novos registros de ocorrência de ambas as espécies são apresentados. column4: [Inglês] Redescription of Atractus albuquerquei (Serpentes: Colubridae: Dipsadinae)VIRGULA with comments on geographical distribution and intraspecific variation
column5: [Português] Atractus albuquerquei Cunha & NascimentoVIRGULA 1983 era conhecida apenas do holótipo procedente do leste do estado do Pará e de 15 espécimes dos estados de Rondônia e AcreVIRGULA no Brasil. Registramos aqui 23 espécimes adicionais provenientes dos estados de RondôniaVIRGULA GoiásVIRGULA Mato Grosso e Mato Grosso do Sul. Estes exemplares ampliam a área de distribuição conhecida de A. albuquerqueiVIRGULA para além do limite sul da bacia amazônica. O holótipo de A. albuquerquei é redescrito e a variação intraespecífica da morfologia externaVIRGULA dos hemipenis e da coloração dos exemplares estudados é analisada. Foi detectado dimorfismo sexual no comprimento total do corpo bem como no número de ventrais (maior nas fêmeas) e de subcaudais (maior nos machos). Foi notada uma correlação significativa entre o número de escamas subcaudais e a longitude (que diminuem de leste para oeste) em ambos os sexos. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Atractus albuquerquei Cunha and NascimentoVIRGULA 1983 was previously known from a holotype from eastern ParáVIRGULA and 15 specimens from Rondônia and AcreVIRGULA all in Brazil. We report on 23 additional specimens from the Brazilian states of RondôniaVIRGULA GoiásVIRGULA Mato GrossoVIRGULA and Mato Grosso do Sul. These specimens extend the known range of A. albuquerquei substantiallyVIRGULA and beyond the southern limits of the Amazon basin. The holotype of A. albuquerquei is redescribed and intraspecific variation in external morphologyVIRGULA hemipenesVIRGULA and colour is documented. Sexual dimorphism exists in total lengthVIRGULA and number of ventral (significantly greater in females) and subcaudal scales (greater in males). There is a significant correlation between number of subcaudal scales and longitude (decreasing from East to West) for both males and females. (AU)

column4: [Português] Plantas de ocorrência espontânea como substratos alternativos para fitoseídeos (AcariVIRGULA Phytoseiidae) em cultivos de seringueira Hevea brasiliensis Muell. Arg. (Euphorbiaceae)VIRGULA [Inglês] Weeds as alternative substrates to phytoseiids (AcariVIRGULA Phytoseiidae) in rubber tree Hevea brasilienisVIRGULA Muell. Arg. (Euphorbiaceae) cultivation
column5: [Português] O objetivo deste estudo foi determinar as espécies de plantas espontâneas em áreas de cultivo de seringueira que poderiam servir com reservatório de ácaros predadores. O trabalho foi conduzido em OlímpiaVIRGULA Estado de São PauloVIRGULA BrasilVIRGULA em dois cultivos de seringueira. A cada três mesesVIRGULA cerca de 1.000 cm3 de folhas de cada uma das cinco espécies de plantas espontâneas dominantes em cada cultivo foi tomada para determinar os fitoseídeos. Como as plantas espontâneas dominantes variaram durante o estudoVIRGULA um total de 20 espécies foi verificado. Somente Cecropia sp. foi dominante em todo estudoVIRGULA em ambos os cultivos. Um total de 336 fitoseídeos pertencentes às seguintes espécies foi encontrado: Euseius citrifolius Denmark & MumaVIRGULA 1970VIRGULA E. concordis (ChantVIRGULA 1959)VIRGULA Galendromus annectens (DeLeonVIRGULA 1958)VIRGULA Iphiseiodes zuluagai Denmark & MumaVIRGULA 1972VIRGULA Neoseiulus anonymus (Chant & BakerVIRGULA 1965) e N. tunus (DeLeonVIRGULA 1967). E. citrifolius (189 espécimes) e N. tunus (138 espécimes) foram os mais abundantes. A maior abundância (231espécimes) e diversidade (5 espécies) foram observadas sobre Cecropia sp. Sobre esta planta foi encontrado o maior número de ácaros por amostra (29 espécimes)VIRGULA seguida por Piper duncum Linnaeus (22)VIRGULA Guarea sp. (18) e Ageratum conyzoides Linnaeus (12). E. citrifolius tem sido determinado como um dos ácaros predadores mais abundantes sobre seringueiras cultivadas na região onde este trabalho foi conduzido. Cecropia sp. parece ser uma das plantas espontâneas mais importantes consideradas como reservatório de E. citrifolius porque está continuamente presente nos cultivos. Estudos complementares poderiam indicar a viabilidade de se manejar esta planta nas áreas de cultivo de seringueira para permitir o controle biológico dos ácaros-praga desta cultura. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The objective of this study was to determine weed species of rubber tree cultivation areas that could serve as reservoirs of predatory mites. The work was conducted in OlímpiaVIRGULA State of São PauloVIRGULA BrazilVIRGULA in two rubber tree plantations. Every three monthsVIRGULA about 1.000 cm3 of leaves of each one of the five dominant weeds in each plantation was taken to determine the phytoseiids. As the dominant weeds varied during the studyVIRGULA a total of 20 species were evaluated. Only Cecropia sp. was a dominant weed throughout the studyVIRGULA in both plantations. A total of 336 phytoseiids of the following species were found: Euseius citrifolius Denmark & MumaVIRGULA 1970VIRGULA E. concordis (ChantVIRGULA 1959)VIRGULA Galendromus annectens (DeLeonVIRGULA 1958)VIRGULA Iphiseiodes zuluagai Denmark & MumaVIRGULA 1972VIRGULA Neoseiulus anonymus (Chant & BakerVIRGULA 1965) and N. tunus (DeLeonVIRGULA 1967). E. citrifolius (189 specimens) and N. tunus (138 specimens) were the most abundant species. The highest abundance (231 specimens) and diversity (5 species) were observed on Cecropia sp. On this plant was found the largest number of mites per sample (29 specimens)VIRGULA followed by Piper duncum Linnaeus (22)VIRGULA Guarea sp. (18) and Ageratum conyzoides Linnaeus (12). E. citrifolius has been determined as the most abundant predatory mite on rubber trees in the region where this work was conducted. Cecropia sp. seems to be the most important of the weeds considered as reservoir of E. citrifolius because it is continuously present in the plantations. Complementary studies could indicate the viability of managing this weed in or around rubber tree plantations to promote the biological control of mite pests on that crop. (AU)

column5: [Português] Os exemplares-tipo de 15 espécies nominais de Salticidae da Venezuela descritas por Lodovico di Caporiacco são examinados. Neste trabalho são apresentadas breves redescrições quando necessárioVIRGULA e três novas sinonímias: Aculeobreda CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Pachomius Peckham & PeckhamVIRGULA 1896PONTOCOMMA Sidusa variegata CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Simonurius quadratarius (SimonVIRGULA 1901)PONTOCOMMA Sitticus cabellensis PrószynskiVIRGULA 1971 = Pseudattulus incertus CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955PONTOCOMMA e cinco novas transferências: Aculeobreda hadzji CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Pachomius hadzji (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Dendryphantes franganilloi CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Metacyrba franganilloi (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Evarcha venezuelica CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Asaracus venezuelicus (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Pseudamphidraus femellus CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Marma femella (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Scopocira sexspinosa CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Sassacus sexspinosus (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov. Phintodes craneae CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955VIRGULA descrita a partir de um jovemVIRGULA é tratada como species inquirenda. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The type specimens of 15 nominal salticid species from Venezuela described by Lodovico di Caporiacco were examined. In this paper we present brief redescriptions when deemed necessary as well as three new synonymies: Aculeobreda CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Pachomius Peckham & PeckhamVIRGULA 1896PONTOCOMMA Sidusa variegata CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Simonurius quadratarius (SimonVIRGULA 1901)PONTOCOMMA Sitticus cabellensis PrószynskiVIRGULA 1971 = Pseudattulus incertus CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955PONTOCOMMA and five new transferences: Aculeobreda hadzji CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Pachomius hadzji (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Dendryphantes franganilloi CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Metacyrba franganilloi (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Evarcha venezuelica CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Asaracus venezuelicus (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Pseudamphidraus femellus CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Marma femella (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov.PONTOCOMMA Scopocira sexspinosa CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955 = Sassacus sexspinosus (CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955) comb. nov. Phintodes craneae CaporiaccoVIRGULA 1955VIRGULA described based on a juvenileVIRGULA must be treated as species inquirenda. (AU)

column4: [Português] Fracionamento e germinação de sementes de EugeniaVIRGULA [Inglês] Germination of Eugenia species seeds after cutting
column5: [Português] Eugenia involucrataVIRGULA E. uniflora and E. brasiliensisVIRGULA espécies arbóreas tropicais do BrasilVIRGULA podem ser utilizadas em programas de reflorestamento e em áreas urbanas e seus frutos apresentam potencialidade de uso industrial. ContudoVIRGULA apesar da elevada porcentagem de germinaçãoVIRGULA a produção de sementes dessas espécies é insuficiente para obtenção de mudas em escala comercial. No presente trabalho são estudados o comportamento germinativo de sementes de três espécies de EugeniaVIRGULA E. involucrata DC. (cereja)VIRGULA E. uniflora L. (pitanga) e E. brasiliensis Lam. (grumixama)VIRGULA submetidas ao fracionamento. As sementes das três espécies foram submetidas a fracionamentosVIRGULA mantendo-se metade do seu tamanho original. Dessa formaVIRGULA além do controle (sem fracionamento)VIRGULA obtiveram-se frações com o hilo íntegroVIRGULA sem o hilo ou com metade do hilo. As sementes íntegras e as frações foram colocadas para germinar sob temperatura constante de 30 ºCVIRGULA luz natural e semeadas em vermiculita. Nas três espéciesVIRGULA sementes fracionadas ao meioVIRGULA contendo pelo menos a metade do hiloVIRGULA mantêm elevada capacidade de iniciar o processo germinativo e de produzir plântulas normais. Os resultados indicam queVIRGULA por meio do fracionamentoVIRGULA é possível obter mais de uma plântula normal a partir de cada semente. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Eugenia involucrataVIRGULA E. uniflora and E. brasiliensisVIRGULA tropical tree species from BrazilVIRGULA could be used in forest regenerationVIRGULA arboriculture and for fruit industrial use. HoweverVIRGULA seed production is not enough to produce seedlings on a commercial scale. In this studyVIRGULA Eugenia involucrataVIRGULA E. uniflora and E. brasiliensis seeds were evaluated for germination and normal seedling production after cutting. Seeds were cut into two parts forming a group with the hilumVIRGULA a group without hilum and a group with half of the hilum. Germination testes were carried out at 30ºC using vermiculite as substrate. Results showed that when E. involucrataVIRGULA E. uniflora and E. brasiliensis seeds were cut into two partsVIRGULA a high percentage of germination was maintained and normal seedlings could be produced. Results showed that it would be possible to obtain more than one normal seedling from each seed. (AU)
