column4: [Português] A regeneração florestal em áreas de floresta secundária na Reserva Florestal do Morro GrandeVIRGULA CotiaVIRGULA SPVIRGULA [Inglês] Forest regeneration in secondary forest areas at Morro Grande Forest ReserveVIRGULA CotiaVIRGULA SP
column5: [Português] Apesar de sua complexidadeVIRGULA é necessário um conhecimento mais sintético sobre o processo de regeneração em florestas tropicais sujeitas a diferentes regimes de perturbaçãoVIRGULA tanto natural como antrópico. Dada a grande extensão de florestas secundárias na região NeotropicalVIRGULA um importante tópico a ser abordado é o potencial dessas manchas de floresta na conservação da diversidade biológica do componente arbóreo típico de manchas de floresta mais antigaVIRGULA menos perturbada. O objetivo principal deste estudo foi avaliar a estrutura da comunidade de plântulas de espécies arbóreas e arbustivas e seu potencial como fonte de regeneração em áreas de floresta secundária na Reserva Florestal do Morro Grande (RFMG)VIRGULA uma das porções mais significativas de Mata Atlântica no Planalto Atlântico. A estrutura e composição da comunidade foram amostradas através de parcelas de 1 m2 alocadas em três áreas de floresta secundária localizadas no interior da RFMG. Foram identificadas 106 espécies dentre as 742 plântulas amostradasVIRGULA distribuídas em 35 famílias e 69 gêneros. As famílias mais ricas (MyrtaceaeVIRGULA FabaceaeVIRGULA Rubiaceae e Lauraceae) representaram 47VIRGULA2% do total de espéciesVIRGULA e as cinco espécies mais abundantes foram Myrcia fallaxVIRGULA Ocotea dispersaVIRGULA Psychotria vellosianaVIRGULA Psychotria suterella e Matayba elaeagnoides. O estrato de regeneração apresentou-se predominantemente constituído de espécies zoocóricas e tolerantes à sombraVIRGULA características de estádios mais avançados da sucessão florestal da Mata Atlântica. A comunidade de plântulas não apresentou variação em sua abundância e estrutura de tamanhoVIRGULA mas a composição de espécies e a riqueza variaram significativamente entre as áreas. Os resultados sugerem que o estrato de regeneração nas áreas de floresta secundária da RFMG tem um alto valor potencial na conservação da diversidade biológica do componente arbóreo típico de manchas de floresta mais antiga eVIRGULA consequentementeVIRGULA na restauração florestal em escala regional. As diferenças espaciais observadas na composição florística e na riqueza da chuva de sementes e da comunidade de plântulas em áreas de floresta secundária no interior da RFMGVIRGULA representam componentes importantes que influenciam o processo de sucessão e a manutenção da diversidade de espéciesVIRGULA pois podem funcionar como fontes de recrutamento de novos indivíduos e de espécies. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Notwithstanding its complexityVIRGULA a more integrated knowledge of the regeneration process in tropical forests subject to natural as well as human disturbance is necessary. Given the great extent of secondary forests in the NeotropicsVIRGULA an important topic to be considered is the potential of secondary forest patches to preserve the biological diversity of old-growthVIRGULA less disturbed forests. The main objective of this study was to evaluate tree seedling community structure and its potential as source of regeneration in areas of secondary forest within the Morro Grande Forest Reserve (RFMG)VIRGULA one of the most important areas of Atlantic Rain Forest on the Atlantic Plateau. The structure and composition of the tree seedling community was sampled in 1 m2 plots randomly placed in three areas of secondary forest. We recognized 106 species among 742 sampled tree seedlingsVIRGULA distributed in 35 families and 69 genera. The richest families (MyrtaceaeVIRGULA FabaceaeVIRGULA Rubiaceae and Lauraceae) represented 47% of the species totalVIRGULA and the five more abundant species were Myrcia fallaxVIRGULA Ocotea dispersaVIRGULA Psychotria vellosianaVIRGULA Psychotria suterellaVIRGULA and Matayba elaeagnoides. Woody species regeneration was predominantly composed of zoochoric and shade tolerant speciesVIRGULA characteristics of more advanced stages of Atlantic Rain Forest succession. Tree seedling community did not vary in abundance and size structureVIRGULA but species composition and richness varied significantly among areas. Our results suggest that woody regeneration in secondary forest areas of the RFMG has a high potential of maintaining tree biological diversity of old-growth forests andVIRGULA consequentlyVIRGULA contributing to forest restoration at the regional scale. Spatial heterogeneity in floristic composition and species richness of the seed rainVIRGULA as well as of the tree seedling community in secondary forest patchesVIRGULA represent important components that influence the sucessional process and the maintenance of species diversityVIRGULA therefore acting as sources of recruitment of new individuals and species. (AU)

column4: [Português] Chuva de sementes em fragmentos de Floresta Atlântica (São PauloVIRGULA SPVIRGULA Brasil)VIRGULA sob diferentes situações de conectividadeVIRGULA estrutura florestal e proximidade da bordaVIRGULA [Inglês] Seed rain in Atlantic forest fragments (São Paulo StateVIRGULA SPVIRGULA Brazil) with different connectivityVIRGULA forest structure and distance to edge
column5: [Português] A composição da chuva de sementes permite inferir sobre o desenvolvimentoVIRGULA o direcionamento sucessional e a regeneração de comunidades vegetais. Em paisagens fragmentadasVIRGULA é grandemente influenciada pela conectividade entre fragmentos remanescentes e pela estrutura da vegetação. Foram comparadas as chuvas de sementes em três fragmentos de Mata Atlântica (Caucaia do AltoVIRGULA SP)VIRGULA em função de seus tamanhosVIRGULA graus de conectividade na paisagemVIRGULA situação de borda e interiorVIRGULA grau de perturbação e características estruturais da vegetaçãoVIRGULA para verificar a influência desses parâmetros nas respectivas chuvas de sementes. As sementes foram classificadas conforme síndrome de dispersão primáriaVIRGULA hábito e tipo funcional das espécies. Foi testada a possível influência da borda sobre esses atributos (qui-quadrado). Padrões entre características dos fragmentos (tamanhoVIRGULA conexão)VIRGULA posição dos coletores (bordaVIRGULA interior) e a abundância dos diferentes diásporos foram explorados por análise de correspondência destendencionada (DCA) e análise de correlação de Spearman. Das 28.873 sementes coletadasVIRGULA a maioria foi de espécies arbóreas (80VIRGULA7%) e zoocóricas (73VIRGULA7%). No fragmento pequeno/isolado houve predominância de espécies arbóreas tardias. O fragmento pequeno/conectado mostrou características opostas às do isolado. O fragmento grande/fonteVIRGULA com a maior diversidadeVIRGULA mostrou uma situação bem definida de borda e interior. Com base nesses parâmetrosVIRGULA os padrões encontrados sugerem uma melhor qualidade ecológica do fragmento pequeno/isoladoVIRGULA seguido do grande/fonte eVIRGULA finalmenteVIRGULA do pequeno/conectado. Houve uma oposição entre os efeitos de conectividade e estrutura da vegetaçãoVIRGULA tendo esta sido mais importante na determinação dos padrões encontrados quanto ao hábitoVIRGULA tipo funcional e síndrome de dispersão das espécies das chuvas de sementes do que a conectividade da paisagem. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Information on seed-rain composition of plant communities allows predictions concerning the successional development of the community and its recovery potential. In fragmented landscapesVIRGULA seed rain is highly influenced by the connectivity among the remaining fragments and by vegetation structure. In this study we compared the seed rain of three fragments of Atlantic forest (Caucaia do AltoVIRGULA SP)VIRGULA taking into account fragment sizeVIRGULA connectivity in the landscapeVIRGULA edge/interior conditionVIRGULA vegetation structureVIRGULA and previous disturbanceVIRGULA to verify how these parameters affected the seed rain. Seeds were classified according to primary dispersal syndromeVIRGULA species life formVIRGULA and functional type. Based on species attributesVIRGULA we tested for possible edge effects (chi-squared). We searched for relationships among fragment features (sizeVIRGULA connectivity)VIRGULA seed trap position (edgeVIRGULA interior)VIRGULA and the abundance of each diaspore type through detrended correspondence analysis (DCA) and Spearman correlation test. The majority of the 28VIRGULA873 seeds belonged to arboreal (80.7%) and zoochoric species (73.7%). Late successional tree species predominated in the small/isolated fragmentVIRGULA while the small/connected fragment showed opposite characteristics. The large/source fragment had the highest species diversity and a well-defined edge. Based on these parametersVIRGULA patterns point to a better ecological condition in the small/isolated fragmentVIRGULA followed by the large/sourceVIRGULA and finally by the small/connected fragments. We found a contrast between the effects of connectivity and vegetation structurePONTOCOMMA the latter was more important than fragment connectivity in determining patterns of life formVIRGULA functional type and dispersal syndrome of seed-rain species. (AU)

column5: [Inglês] Hymenaea stigonocarpa Mart. ex HayneVIRGULA known as jatobá-do-cerrado has extrafloral nectaries (EFNs)VIRGULA which are reported for the first time in Hymenaea genus. In this research the originVIRGULA distributionVIRGULA structureVIRGULA and ultrastructure of the EFNs were studied. Samples of leaflets at different developmental stages were collectedVIRGULA fixed and processed by standard methods for analyses at light and electronic microscopesPONTOCOMMA histochemical tests were employed to determine the nature of secretion products. EFNs are distributed all over leaf bladeVIRGULA more concentrated on the basal and medial thirds of each leaflet. These nectaries are embedded in the mesophyllVIRGULA show secretory tissue surrounded by an endodermisVIRGULA and are vascularized by xylem and phloem. EFN secretory activity was exclusively observed in young leaves. The protoderm origins the EFN secretory tissueVIRGULA the ground meristem originates the endodermis and the procambium originates the vascular tissues. Secretory cells of functional EFNs showed dense cytoplasmVIRGULA large nucleusVIRGULA mitochondriaVIRGULA plastids with a poorly developed membrane systemVIRGULA oil drops scattered in the cytosolVIRGULA dictyosomeVIRGULA and smooth endoplasmic reticulum segments. Secretion was released by cuticle rupture and contains polysaccharides and lipids. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] O jatobá-do-cerrado (Hymenaea stigonocarpa Mart. ex Hayne) apresenta nectários extraflorais (NEFs)VIRGULA os quais são descritos pela primeira vez no gênero. Amostras de folhas em várias fases de desenvolvimento foram coletadasVIRGULA fixadas e processadas para estudos em microscopia de luz e eletrônica de transmissão e varreduraVIRGULA segundo técnicas convencionais. Testes histoquímicos foram empregados para determinar a natureza química da secreção. Os NEFs estão distribuídos por todo o limboVIRGULA sendo mais concentrados nos terços basal e médio de cada folíolo. Estes nectários são embutidos no mesofiloVIRGULA apresentam tecido secretor envolvido por uma endoderme e são vascularizados por xilema e floema. A atividade secretora dos NEFs é limitada à fase juvenil da folha. Nas folhas mais velhasVIRGULA os NEFs tornam-se não funcionais. O tecido secretor dos NEFs é formado a partir da protodermeVIRGULA enquanto a endoderme tem origem no meristema fundamental. A secreção é liberada por meio de rupturas cuticulares e apresenta polissacarídeos e lipídios. (AU)

column4: [Português] Morfoanatomia da raiz tuberosa de Vernonia oxylepis Sch. Bip. in Mart. ex Baker - AsteraceaeVIRGULA [Inglês] Morpho-anatomy of the tuberous root of Vernonia oxylepis Sch. Bip. in Mart. ex Baker - Asteraceae
column5: [Inglês] Several native herbaceous and subshrub species native to the Cerrado in Brazil are geophytesVIRGULA that isVIRGULA they survive the unfavorable dry season and low temperaturesVIRGULA that sometimes coincide with fireVIRGULA with only the underground system intact. Vernonia oxylepis is one of these species and the aim of this study was to describe the morpho-anatomy of the tuberous root and bud formation on this structure. The main axis of this root is perpendicular to the soil surfaceVIRGULA and from which aerial shoots arise periodically throughout the life cycle. On the upper portion of the rootVIRGULA self-grafting of the shoots occurs. The root stores lipids and fructansVIRGULA exhibits contraction and produces reparatory budsPONTOCOMMA adventitious buds arise from proliferated pericycle. These characteristics may be related to adaptation of this species to conditions in the Cerrado. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Várias espécies herbáceas e subarbustivasVIRGULA nativas do Cerrado no BrasilVIRGULA são geofitasVIRGULA ou sejaVIRGULA sobrevivem ao período desfavorável de déficit hídrico e de baixas temperaturasVIRGULA que muitas vezes coincide com incêndiosVIRGULA mantendo apenas a porção subterrânea. Vernonia oxylepis é uma dessas espécies e o objetivo desse estudo foi descrever a morfo-anatomia da raiz tuberosa e a formação das gemas nessa raiz. Tal raiz é constituída de um eixo orientado perpendicularmente no soloVIRGULA a partir do qual ramos aéreos são formados na porção proximalVIRGULA situada ao nível do soloVIRGULA ao longo do ciclo de vida da planta. Na porção proximal da raiz ocorre auto-enxertia da base dos ramos por ela emitidos. A raiz acumula lipídios e frutanosVIRGULA apresenta ligeira contração e forma gemas reparativasPONTOCOMMA a formação das gemas adventícias se dá a partir do periciclo proliferado. Tais características poderiam ser associadas ao processo de adaptação da espécie às condições do Cerrado. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Soil loss risk and habitat quality in streams of a meso-scale river basinVIRGULA [Português] Risco de perda de solo e qualidade do habitat numa bacia hidrográfica de meso-escala
column5: [Português] Expectativa de perda de solo e possíveis relações entre erosãoVIRGULA vegetação ripária e qualidade da água foram estudadas na bacia do rio São José dos Dourados (SP). Através de recursos de geoprocessamento e da equação universal de perda de solosVIRGULA os dados sobre expectativa de perda de solo foram levantados. Para a área de drenagem total e a faixa tampão dos corpos d'água de 22 sub-bacias aleatoriamente selecionadasVIRGULA analisou-se a cobertura do solo predominante e qualidade do habitat. Devido principalmente à alta erodibilidade do soloVIRGULA a área estudada é altamente suscetível ao processo erosivo. As análises de qualidade da água revelaram que as águas superficiais das sub-bacias estão quimicamente não impactadasVIRGULA mas fisicamente degradadas. A alta pureza química deve-seVIRGULA possivelmenteVIRGULA à ausência de áreas urbanizadas ao longo das sub-bacias e as alterações nas características físicas sãoVIRGULA possivelmenteVIRGULA decorrentes das altas taxas de transferência de sedimento aos corpos d'água e à quase ausência de mata ciliar. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Soil loss expectation and possible relationships among soil erosionVIRGULA riparian vegetation and water quality were studied in the São José dos Dourados River basinVIRGULA State of São PauloVIRGULA Brazil. Through Geographic Information System (GIS) resources and technologyVIRGULA Soil Loss Expectation (SLE) data obtained using the Universal Soil Loss Equation (USLE) model were analyzed. For the whole catchment area and for the 30 m buffer strips of the streams of 22 randomly selected catchmentsVIRGULA the predominant land use and habitat quality were studied. Owing mainly to the high soil erodibilityVIRGULA the river basin is highly susceptible to erosive processes. Habitat quality analyses revealed that the superficial water from the catchments is not chemically impacted but suffers physical damage. A high chemical purity is observed since there are no urban areas along the catchments. The water is physically poor because of high rates of sediment delivery and the almost nonexistence of riparian vegetation. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Genetic variability in natural populations of Zeyheria montana mart. from the Brazilian CerradoVIRGULA [Português] Variabilidade genética entre e dentro de populações naturais de Zeyheria montana mart. do Cerrado brasileiro
column5: [Inglês] Zeyheria montanaVIRGULA an endemic species of the Bignoniaceae family from the Brazilian Cerrado's known for its anti-cancer propertiesVIRGULA is widely used as imuno stimulant in the popular medicine and its therapeutic activity must be validated by scientific data. The objective of this work was to evaluate the genetic variability of eight plant populations collected within the state of São PauloVIRGULA BrazilVIRGULA via Random Amplification of Polymorphic DNA (RAPD) used as molecular markers. After an optimized protocol for the amplification reactionVIRGULA nine selected primers generated 105 reproducible bandsVIRGULA indicating up to 60% polymorphism. Analysis of molecular variance (AMOVA) revealed higher genetic variation within populations (84.03%) than among populations (15.97%). The variation values estimated by &#934PONTOCOMMAst (0.160) indicated moderate to high inter population structuration. Levels of similarity inter plants with genetic and geographical distancesVIRGULA estimated by the unweighted pair-group method analysis (UPGMA) clustering and non-metric multidimensional scaling (NMDS) ordination methods and by the Mantel test (-0.2345 p = 0.118) denoted that the structure found follows the island modelVIRGULA which assumes that a single population of infinite size may have initiated the existing populations of Zeyheria montanaVIRGULA with no spatial position correlation. Based on the obtained dataVIRGULA a germplasm bank from individuals representing the species variability was established. Furthermore the information here reported can be of importance to develop strategies for the conservation of Z. montana. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Zeyheria montanaVIRGULA planta arbustiva da família BignoniaceaeVIRGULA é uma espécie endêmica do cerrado e possui atividade anti-câncerVIRGULA sendo utilizada como estimulante na medicina popular. O objetivo deste estudo foi avaliar a variabilidade genética de oito populações localizadas no estado de São PauloVIRGULA utilizando marcadores moleculares de polimorfismo de DNA amplificado ao acaso (RAPD). Após a otimização da reação de amplificaçãoVIRGULA nove iniciadores selecionados geraram 105 fragmentos RAPD reprodutíveisVIRGULA sendo que a maioria (60VIRGULA0%) foi polimórfica. A análise molecular de variância (AMOVA) mostrou que a variabilidade dentro de populações (84VIRGULA03%) foi maior que entre populações (15VIRGULA97%). As estimativas de variação &#934PONTOCOMMAst (0VIRGULA1597) indicam estruturação populacional moderadamente alta. O agrupamento por meio de UPGMAVIRGULA a ordenação pelo NMDS e o teste de Mantel entre as matrizes de distâncias genéticas e geográficas demonstraram que a estruturação encontrada segue um modelo de ilhasVIRGULA onde uma única população de tamanho infinito pode ter dado origem às populações atuais de ZeyheriaVIRGULA sem relação com sua posição espacial. Com base nos resultados obtidos foi estruturado um banco de germoplasma de indivíduosVIRGULA representando a variabilidade da espécie. AdicionalmenteVIRGULA as informações deste estudo são importantes para dar suporte a estratégias de conservação de Z. montana. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Essential oil composition of fruit colour varieties of Eugenia brasiliensis LamVIRGULA [Português] Composição dos óleos essenciais de variedades de coloração de frutos de Eugenia brasiliensis Lam
column5: [Português] A espécie Eugenia brasiliensis Lam. apresenta a coloração dos frutos variávelVIRGULA sendo reconhecidas três variedades. EntretantoVIRGULA a definição de variedades não é fácil para espécies de Myrtaceae e também não é amplamente aceita. Duas variedades de Eugenia brasiliensisVIRGULA baseado na cor dos frutos (roxos e amarelos)VIRGULA tiveram a composição de seus óleos essenciais analisadas com a finalidade de obter indícios de variedade botânica para esta espécie. EmboraVIRGULA os componentes principais nos óleos das folhas fossem os mesmos monoterpenos para ambas as variedadesVIRGULA alfa-pinenoVIRGULA beta-pineno e 1VIRGULA8-cineolVIRGULA a variedade com frutos roxos acumulou maior quantidade de sesquiterpenos oxigenados (33VIRGULA9%) do que aquela com frutos amarelos (3VIRGULA8%). As diferenças principais ocorreram nos frutos roxos que apresentaram como componente principal o óxido de cariofileno (22VIRGULA2%) e o alfa-cadinol (10VIRGULA4%)VIRGULA não detectados no óleo das folhasVIRGULA e o óleo dos frutos amarelos apresentou uma composição similar àquela observada para as folhas. Estas variedades de coloração dos frutos de E. brasiliensis podem ser consideradas como dois quimiotipos distintosVIRGULA uma vez que na variedade com frutos roxos a rota biossintética para sesquiterpenos se encontra mais operante do que naquela com frutos amarelosVIRGULA onde são acumulados principalmente os monoterpenos. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Eugenia brasiliensis Lam. is a variable species concerning fruit colorVIRGULA with three recognized varieties. HoweverVIRGULA the definition of varieties is not easy for Myrtaceae species and not widely accepted. Two fruit color varieties (purple and yellow) of E. brasiliensis had their essential oil composition analyzed in order to give support to the existence of varieties for this species. AlthoughVIRGULA the major components in the leaf oil are the same monoterpenes for both varietiesVIRGULA alpha-pineneVIRGULA beta-pinene and 1VIRGULA8-cineolVIRGULA the purple fruit variety accumulates more oxygenated sesquiterpenes (33.9%) than the one with yellow fruits (3.8%). The major differences occurred in purple fruits that present as major components caryophyllene oxide (22.2%) and alpha-cadinol (10.4%)VIRGULA not found in the leaf oilVIRGULA and the yellow fruit oil presented a similar composition as observed for the leaves. These fruit color varieties of E. brasiliensis can be considered as two distinct chemotypesVIRGULA since the sesquiterpene pathway is more operant in the purple variety than in the yellow oneVIRGULA in which monoterpenes are mainly accumulated. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Bioactive flavone dimers from Ouratea multiflora (Ochnaceae)VIRGULA [Português] Dímeros flavônicos bioativos de Ouratea multiflora (Ochnaceae)
column5: [Inglês] Chromatographic fractionation of the organic extract from leaves of Ouratea multiflora afforded the flavone dimers heveaflavoneVIRGULA amentoflavone-7VIRGULA4-dimethyl eterVIRGULA podocarpusflavone-A and amentoflavone. column4: [Inglês] Why biogeographical hypotheses need a well supported phylogenetic framework: a conceptual evaluation
column5: [Inglês] A growing number of biogeographically methods have attempted to describe formal means of reconstructing the biogeographically history of the organisms. Whatever the biogeographically methodVIRGULA howeverVIRGULA the source of systematic information has to be well worked out. Taxonomic noise is sometimes a true impediment to properly deal with the complexity of life in its three-dimensional aspectsVIRGULA the threefold parallelism represented by formVIRGULA space and time. This paper argues that historical systematic is a necessary basis for a historical biogeography. Organism phylogenies or at least hypotheses of monophyly should be taken as the basis for the study of distribution patterns. Whenever a non-monophyletic taxon is misleadingly taken as monophyleticVIRGULA erroneous interpretations in evolutionary analyses necessarily follow. When the proportion of paraphyletic taxon considered in an analysis is smallVIRGULA a general pattern may be obtainedVIRGULA but the interpretation of the biogeographically evolution of each paraphyletic taxon will be equivocated. The delimitation of areas of endemism also depends on the precision of the recovered phylogenetic information. Indices based on phylogenetic diversity allow the delimitation of areas for conservation of biological diversity. Despite the plethora of current available biogeographically methodsVIRGULA biogeography is not a messVIRGULA as was pointed elsewhere. The order in the discipline is subtle: as biogeography intends to comprehend the living world based on the study of the formVIRGULA space and timeVIRGULA a phylogenetic framework is a basic requirement. The lack of reliable biogeographically primary information - historical taxes - certainly creates severe obstacles for historical biogeography. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Um crescente número de métodos biogeográficos tem buscado descrever maneiras formais de reconstruir a história biogeográfica dos organismos. EntretantoVIRGULA para qualquer método biogeográfico empregadoVIRGULA a fonte de informação sistemática deve ser precisa. Ruído taxonômico são por vezes um verdadeiro obstáculo para se tratar apropriadamente da complexidade da vida no seu aspecto tridimensionalVIRGULA representado pelo triplo paralelismo formaVIRGULA espaço e tempo. Esse artigo defende que a sistemática é o fundamento necessário para a biogeografia histórica. Filogenias de organismos ou ao menos hipóteses de monofiletismo devem ser a base para o estudo de padrões de distribuição. Táxons não-monofiléticos tomados erroneamente como monofiléticos resultarão em interpretações incorretas nas análises evolutivas. Quando a proporção de táxons parafiléticos considerada em uma análise é pequenaVIRGULA um padrão geral pode ser obtidoVIRGULA mas a interpretação da evolução biogeográfica de cada táxon parafilético será equivocada. A delimitação de áreas de endemismoVIRGULA da mesma formaVIRGULA também depende da precisão da informação filogenética. Além dissoVIRGULA índices baseados na diversidade filogenética permitem a delimitação de áreas para a conservação da diversidade biológica. Apesar da pletora de métodos biogeográficos correntesVIRGULA a biogeografia não é uma confusãoVIRGULA como foi apontado anteriormente. A ordem nessa disciplina é sutil: como a biogeografia pretende compreender o mundo natural baseando-se no estudo de formaVIRGULA tempo e espaçoVIRGULA um arcabouço filogenético é condição essencial. A ausência de informação biogeográfica primária confiável - táxons históricos - cria sérios obstáculos para a biogeografia histórica. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Taxonomic identification of the Megaloolithid egg and eggshells from the Cretaceous Bauru Basin (Minas GeraisVIRGULA Brazil): comparison with the Auca Mahuevo (Argentina) titanosaurid eggs
column5: [Português] Os ovos e cascas de ovos provenientes de Auca Mahuevo (PatagoniaVIRGULA Argentina) e identificados taxonomicamente como sendo de titanossaurídeos servem de base para comparação e identificação de ovos megaloolithídeos encontrados em outras localidades. Investigações prévias determinaram que os materiais zoológicos encontrados em Neuquén (Megaloolithus patagonicus) e no Peru (M. pseudomamillare) estão na realidade relacionados a dinossauros titanossaurídeos. O estudo de um ovo e diversos fragmentos de cascas de ovos (megaloolithídeo) provenientes do Cretáceo superior da formação Marília sugere que o mesmo grupo taxonômico de dinossauros titanossauros que ocorria no Campaniano tardio da bacia Neuquén também estava presente e se reproduzia durante o Cretáceo na bacia BauruVIRGULA isto porque os caracteres zoológicos estudados são reconhecíveis ao nível genérico. Além dissoVIRGULA foi sugerido que estes titanossauros do sítio de Auca Mahuevo apresentavam comportamento reprodutivo colonial e fidelidade ao sítio de desova. A presença deste tipo de comportamento reprodutivo apontaria para a existência de sítios de desova similares nas formações do Cretáceo superior da bacia BauruVIRGULA ainda a serem descobertosVIRGULA já que a localidade de Peirópolis representa um depósito secundário onde os fósseis foram transportados através de um sistema fluvial de alta-energia. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The taxonomically (titanosaurid) identified eggs and eggshells of Auca Mahuevo (PatagoniaVIRGULA Argentina) provide an opportunity to compare and identify orphan megaloolithid eggs found elsewhere. Previous investigation determined that the zoological material from Neuquén (Megaloolithus patagonicus) and Peru (M. pseudomamillare) are related to titanosaurid dinosaurs. Examination of an egg and several (megaloolithid) eggshell fragments from the Upper Cretaceous Marilia Formation strongly suggestsVIRGULA as zoological characters are at least genus specificVIRGULA that the same group of titanosaur dinosaursVIRGULA which lived in the Neuquén Basin during the Late CampanianVIRGULA were also present and reproducing in the Cretaceous Bauru Basin (Brazil). FurthermoreVIRGULA it has been suggested that these titanosaursVIRGULA based on the site of Auca MahuevoVIRGULA demonstrated colonial nesting and nesting fidelity. These reproductive behaviors would advocate that similar nesting sites should exist in the Upper Cretaceous formations of the Bauru Basin and remain to be discoveredVIRGULA as the present Peiropolis locality represents a secondary deposit where fossils have been transported by high-energy fluvial system. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] New flavone from the leaves of Neea theifera (Nyctaginaceae)
column5: [Português] Neea theifera Oerst. (Nyctaginaceae) é amplamente utilizada na medicina popular brasileira para tratamento de úlceras gástricas e inflamação. A investigação fitoquímica das folhas de Neea theifera permitiu o isolamento e identificação da nova flavona luteolina-7-O-[2''-O-(5'''-O-feruloil)- beta-D-apiofuranosil]-beta-D-glucopiranosídeo (1) além dos oito compostos conhecidos vitexinaVIRGULA isovitexinaVIRGULA isoorientinaVIRGULA orientinaVIRGULA vicenina-2VIRGULA crisoeriolVIRGULA apigenina e luteolina. A identificação química foi realizada por métodos espectroscópicos incluindo RMN-2DVIRGULA bem como análises no UV e IES-EM. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Neea theifera Oerst. (Nyctaginaceae) is widely used in Brazilian folk medicine for the treatment of gastric ulcers and inflammation. Phytochemical investigation of the leaves of Neea theifera afforded the isolation of the new flavone luteolin-7-O-[2''-O-(5'''-O-feruloyl)- beta-D-apiofuranosyl]-beta-D-glucopyranoside (1) besides the eight-known compounds vitexinVIRGULA isovitexinVIRGULA isoorientinVIRGULA orientinVIRGULA vicenin-2VIRGULA chrysoeriolVIRGULA apigenin and luteolin. Their chemical identification was established by NMR spectroscopic methods including 2D-NMRVIRGULA as well as UV and ESI-MS analyses. (AU)

column5: [Inglês] A new antifungal phenolic glycosideVIRGULA 3VIRGULA4VIRGULA5-trimethoxyphenyl-1-O-beta-D-(5-O-syringoyl)apiofuranosyl-(1-6)-beta-D-glucopyranoside (1)VIRGULA together with four known iridoidsVIRGULA geniposidic acid (2)VIRGULA geniposide (3)VIRGULA 6alpha-hydroxygeniposide (4) and 6beta-hydroxygeniposide (5)PONTOCOMMA two lignansVIRGULA (+)-lyoniresinol-3alpha-O-beta-D-glucopyranoside (6)VIRGULA (-)-lyoniresinol-3alpha-O-beta-D-glucopyranoside (7)PONTOCOMMA and two phenolic acidsVIRGULA chlorogenic (8) and salicylic acids (9) and D-manitol (10)VIRGULA were isolated from the ethanolic extract of the stems of Alibertia sessilis. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Um novo derivado fenólico glucosilado antifúngicoVIRGULA 3VIRGULA4VIRGULA5-trimetoxifenil-1-O-beta-D-(5-Osiringoila)-apiofuranosil-(1-6)-beta-D-glicopiranosideo (1)VIRGULA juntamente com quatro iridóides conhecidosVIRGULA ácido geniposídico (2)VIRGULA geniposídeo (3)VIRGULA 6alfa-hidroxigeniposideo (4) e 6betahidroxigeniposideo (5)PONTOCOMMA duas lignanasVIRGULA (+)-lioniresinol-3alfa-O-beta-D-glicopiranosideo (6)VIRGULA (-)lioniresinol-3alfa-O-beta-D-glicopiranosideo (7)PONTOCOMMA e dois ácidos fenólicosVIRGULA ácidos clorogênico (8) e salicílico (9) e D-manitol (10)VIRGULA foram isolados do extrato etanólico dos galhos de Alibertia sessilis. column4: [Inglês] Biosynthetic origin of the isoprene units in chromenes of Piper aduncum (Piperaceae)
column5: [Português] Estudos metabólicos envolvendo a incorporação de D-glicose-[1-13C] em folhas de Piper aduncum (Piperaceae) mostraram que as vias do mevalonato (MVA) e da triose-piruvato (MEP) estão envolvidas na biossíntese da unidade isoprênica presente no 2VIRGULA2-dimetil-2H-1-cromeno-6-carboxilato de metila (1) e no 2VIRGULA2-dimetil-8-(3'-metil-2'-butenil)-2H-1-cromeno-6-carboxilato de metila (2). O padrão de incorporação dos carbonos marcados com D-glicose-[1-13C] destes cromenos foram determinados através de espectroscopia de RMN de 13C quantitativo. Os resultados confirmaram que o compartimento biossintético de 1 e 2 pode ser o plastídio e/ou citosolVIRGULA ou possivelmente um compartimento adicionalVIRGULA como o espaço entre a membrana e o plastídio. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Metabolic studies involving the incorporation of [1-13C]-D-glucose into intact leaves of Piper aduncum (Piperaceae) have indicated that both the mevalonate (MVA) and the pyruvate-triose (MEP) non-mevalonate pathways are implicated in the biosynthesis of isoprene moieties present in methyl 2VIRGULA2-dimethyl-2H-1-chromene-6-carboxylate (1) and methyl 2VIRGULA2-dimethyl-8-(3'-methyl-2'-butenyl)-2H-1-chromene-6-carboxylate (2). The pattern of incorporation of label from [1-13C]-D-glucose into these chromenes was determined by quantitative 13C NMR spectroscopy. The results confirmed that biosynthetic compartment of 1 and 2 could either be the plastid and/or the cytosol orVIRGULA possiblyVIRGULA an additional compartment such as the plastid inter-membrane space. (AU)

column4: [Português] Oportunismo alimentar de Knodus moenkhausii (TeleosteiVIRGULA Characidae): uma espécie abundante em riachos do noroeste do estado de São PauloVIRGULA BrasilVIRGULA [Inglês] Feeding opportunism of Knodus moenkhausii (TeleosteiVIRGULA Characidae): an abundant species in streams of the northwestern in the state of São PauloVIRGULA Brazil
column5: [Inglês] In the present investigation we studied the feeding biology of Knodus moenkhausii (Eigenmann & KennedyVIRGULA 1903) in streams of the Upper Paraná river system in the state of São Paulo. In eight streams (R1-R8)VIRGULA K. moenkhausii consumed 18 itemsVIRGULA of which algaeVIRGULA ephemeropteran nymphsVIRGULA and dipteran larvae were the most frequent and dominant autochthonous itemsVIRGULA as were terrestrial insectsVIRGULA hymenopteransVIRGULA and spiders regarding allochthonous items. In the R2 streamVIRGULA K. moenkhausii showed distinct dietVIRGULA mostly due to depthVIRGULA substrate typeVIRGULA and presence of riparian vegetation. In the R9 stream (monthly sampled for one year)VIRGULA 15 items were consumedVIRGULA of which terrestrial insects predominated all year roundPONTOCOMMA dipteran larvae and algae were least relevant during December-January (hot and wet period) and June-July (cold and dry period)VIRGULA respectively. During snorkeling observations in this streamVIRGULA we recorded individuals performing drift feedingVIRGULA picking at relatively small preys close to the substrate and submerged vegetationVIRGULA and surface picking. The large diversity of consumed items - conditioned to habitat and seasonal variations - and the diversity of feeding tactics allow us to consider K. moenkhausii a rather opportunistic fish species. Such opportunism apparently reflects on the species abundanceVIRGULA showing its ability to allocate a significant part of its energy to reproductionVIRGULA even in physically impacted habitats by human actions. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] O objetivo deste estudo foi investigar a biologia alimentar de Knodus moenkhausii (Eigenmann & KennedyVIRGULA 1903) em riachos do Alto rio Paraná no Estado de São Paulo. Em oito riachos (R1-R8)VIRGULA K. moenkhausii se alimentou de 18 itensVIRGULA dos quais algasVIRGULA ninfas de efemerópteros e larvas de dípteros foram os itens autóctones mais freqüentes e dominantesPONTOCOMMA fragmentos de insetos terrestresVIRGULA himenópteros e aranhas foram os itens alóctones mais freqüentes e dominantes. No riacho R2VIRGULA K. moenkhausii apresentou dieta distinta dos demais riachosVIRGULA principalmente em função da profundidadeVIRGULA tipo de substrato e da presença de vegetação ripária. No riacho R9VIRGULA amostrado mensalmente durante um anoVIRGULA foram identificados 15 itensVIRGULA dos quais insetos terrestres predominaram ao longo do anoPONTOCOMMA larvas de dípteros e algas foram pouco expressivas nos períodos de dezembro-janeiro (período mais quente e chuvoso) e junho-julho (período mais frio e seco). No riacho R9 foram realizadas observações subaquáticas durante mergulho livreVIRGULA onde observamos a cata de itens na coluna d'água junto do substratoVIRGULA da vegetação submersa e na superfície da água. A elevada variedade de itens consumidos - condicionada às variações do hábitat e sazonais - e a prática de diversas táticas nos permitem considerar K. moenkhausii uma espécie oportunista quanto ao uso dos recursos alimentares. Este oportunismo aparentemente se reflete na abundância da espécieVIRGULA demonstrando boa capacidade em alocar parte significativa de sua energia à reproduçãoVIRGULA mesmo em ambientes fisicamente impactados por ação antrópica. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Vernonia polyanthes as a new source of antiulcer drugs
column5: [Inglês] Methanolic (VPME) and chloroformic (VPCL) extractsVIRGULA obtained from the aerial parts of Vernonia polyanthesVIRGULA were investigated for its antiulcerogenic properties. Administration of VPME (250 mg/kg) and VPCL (50 mg/kg) significantly inhibited the gastric mucosa damage (64% and 90%VIRGULA respectively) caused by absolute ethanol (p.o.). OtherwiseVIRGULA in NSAID-induced gastric damageVIRGULA their gastroprotective effects have decreased. Since the VPCL extract resulted to be more effective than the VPME we focused our efforts over VPCL action mechanism of action. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] The use of standard methodology for determination of antifungal activity of natural products against medical yeasts Candida sp and Cryptococcus spVIRGULA [Português] Aplicação de metodologia padronizada para determinação da atividade antifúngica de produtos naturais contra as leveduras Candida sp and Cryptococcus sp
column5: [Inglês] Methodology for testing natural compounds for determination of antifungal activity had been developed with adaptations. The most used are bioautography and agar diffusion with a complex and no defined media. In this studyVIRGULA different methods for determination of antifungal activity of natural products are discussed and the use of M27-A2 microdilution test from CLSI (Clinical and Laboratory Standards InstituteVIRGULA 2002)VIRGULA as general standard methodology for testing plant extracts activity is recommended. (AU)VIRGULA [Português] Metodologias para determinar atividade antifúngica foram desenvolvidas com adaptações para avaliar produtos naturais. As mais usadas são bioautografia e o método de difusão em agarVIRGULA que empregam meios de cultura complexosVIRGULA não definidos. Neste estudo são discutidos os métodos para determinação de atividade antifúngica de produtos naturais e é recomendado o uso do micrométodo modificado segundo o documento M27A2 do CLSI. (AU)

column4: [Português] Estudo cariotípico de duas espécies brasileiras do gênero Micrurus (Ophidia: Elapidae)VIRGULA [Inglês] Karyotypic studies of two Brazilian species of the genus Micrurus (Ophidia: Elapidae)
column5: [Português] Descrevemos neste trabalho o cariótipo de duas espécies de cobra coral (Ophidia: Elapidae) do Brasil: Micrurus corallinus e M. ibiboboca. Preparações citológicas foram obtidas através da técnica de esmagamentoVIRGULA seguida de coloração convencional com Giemsa. Encontramos para M. corallinusVIRGULA um número diplóide (2n) de 40 cromossomosVIRGULA com fórmula cariotípica 40 (4PONTOCOMMA 16PONTOCOMMA 20) e constricção secundária no segundo par de macrocromossomos subtelocêntricos. Micrurus ibiboboca apresentou 2n = 42VIRGULA com fórmula cariotípica 42 (2PONTOCOMMA 20PONTOCOMMA 20) e constricção secundária no primeiro par de macrocromossomos telocêntricos. As primeiras descrições dos cariótipos das espécies M. corallinus e M. ibibobocaVIRGULA apresentadas neste trabalhoVIRGULA mostram aspectos semelhantes aos cariótipos de M. lemniscatus e M. surinamensisVIRGULA únicas espécies deste gênero da América do Sul analisadas cromossomicamente. As quatro espécies em questão apresentam o mesmo número de microcromossomos (20)VIRGULA os maiores valores de macrocromossomos telocêntricos ou subtelocêntricos e os maiores números diplóides (2n) já encontrados no gênero Micrurus. Tais características diferenciam estas espécies da América do Sul das nove da América Central com cariótipos já estudados. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The karyotypes of two Brazilian species of coral snakes (Ophidia: Elapidae): Micrurus corallinus and M. ibiboboca are described for the first time. Cytological preparations were obtained through the technique of squashingVIRGULA followed by conventional Giemsa staining. The diploid number for Micrurus corallinus was 40 chromosomes with a karyotype formulae 40 (4PONTOCOMMA 16PONTOCOMMA 20) with a secondary constriction in the second pair of subtelocentric macrochromosomes. Micrurus ibiboboca is described by the formulae 42 (2PONTOCOMMA 20PONTOCOMMA 20) with 2n = 42 with a secondary constriction in the first pair of telocentric macrochromosomes. The karyotypes of M. corallinus and M. ibiboboca present aspects similar to M. lemniscatus and M. surinamensisVIRGULA the only previously analyzed species of this genus in South America. These four species have the same number of microchromosomes (20)VIRGULA the largest number of telocentric or subtelocentric macrochromosomes and the largest diploid numbers (2n) ever found in the genus Micrurus. These characteristics differ from those of the nine known species of Central America. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Phylogenetic relationships and karyotype evolution in the sigmodontine rodent Akodon (2n = 10 and 2n = 16) from Brazil
column5: [Inglês] Comparison of G-bands from 2n = 10 and 2n = 16 karyotypes of Akodon revealed tandem fusionsVIRGULA pericentric inversions and Robertsonian rearrangement in autosomes and addition/deletion of constitutive heterochromatin in sex chromosomes. Cytochrome-b sequences indicate that the 2n = 10 karyotype is a new species and show it to be a sister taxon of the 2n = 14VIRGULA 2n = 15 and 2n = 16 karyotypes. IndeedVIRGULA this group shows a particular evolutionary situation in which a unique taxonomic unit based on morphological data can be detectedVIRGULA butVIRGULA karyologicallyVIRGULA it can be separated into two groups (2n = 14-15-16 and 2n = 10). Cytochrome-b sequences show a finer resolutionVIRGULA indicating that these four karyotypes represent three molecular entities (2n = 14-15VIRGULA 2n = 16 and 2n = 10) that may be derived from a common ancestor with a 2n = 16 karyotype. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Comparative analysis of volatiles from Drimys brasiliensis Miers and D. angustifolia Miers (Winteraceae) from Southern Brazil
column5: [Inglês] The essential oils obtained from Southern Brazilian native Drimys brasiliensis Miers and Drimys angustifolia Miers were analyzed by GC and GC/MS. The oils from leaves of both species showed predominance of monoterpenoidsVIRGULA while the oils from stem barks were characterized by sesquiterpenoids. Bicyclogermacrene (20.0% in leaves and 25.4% in stem bark) and drimenol (1.4% in leaves and 26.2% in stem bark) were the most abundant in D. angustifoliaVIRGULA and cyclocolorenone (from 16.0% to 32.3% in fresh and dried leaves and almost 50% in stem bark) in D. brasiliensis. The oil from fruits of D. brasiliensis was also analyzed and presented 31.0% of cyclocolorenone. The predominance of this unusual aromadendrane-type sesquiterpene in D. brasiliensis essential oils could be used as a chemosystematic marker. (AU)

column4: [Português] Tolerância à dessecação de sementes de espécies de EugeniaVIRGULA [Inglês] Desiccation tolerance of seeds of species of Eugenia
column5: [Português] O objetivo deste trabalho foi avaliar a tolerância à dessecação de sementes de seis espécies frutíferas nativas de Eugenia (E. brasiliensis Lam.VIRGULA E. cerasiflora Miq.VIRGULA E. involucrata DC.VIRGULA E. pyriformis Camb.VIRGULA E. umbelliflora Berg. e E. uniflora L.) e fornecer subsídios para a conservação do poder germinativo dessas sementes durante o armazenamento. As sementes foram submetidas a secagens progressivasVIRGULA em estufa (40ºC) e em câmaras com sílica-gel (25ºC)VIRGULA até 10% de água. Após cada secagemVIRGULA as sementes foram avaliadas quanto ao teor de água e germinação. Observou-se relação significativa entre a diminuição do teor de água e a redução do poder germinativoVIRGULA independentemente do processo de secagem. Apesar de diferenças nos limites de tolerância à dessecação das sementes das diferentes espéciesVIRGULA a redução do teor de água para valores inferiores a 45% sempre prejudicou a germinação dessas sementesVIRGULA que perderam a capacidade germinativa quando o teor de água foi inferior a 15%. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The objective of this work was to evaluate the desiccation tolerance of seeds of six fruit species of Eugenia (E. brasiliensis Lam.VIRGULA E. cerasiflora Miq.VIRGULA E. involucrata DC.VIRGULA E. pyriformis Camb.VIRGULA E. umbelliflora Berg. and E. uniflora L.) aiming to provide information for the conservation of the germinability of these seeds during storage. Seeds were dried continuously in oven (40ºC) or closed chambers with silica gel (25ºC) until 10% water content. After dryingVIRGULA samples of the seeds were analyzed for water content and germination. As water content decreasedVIRGULA seeds lost viabilityVIRGULA independently of the drying method. Seeds from each species differed on sensitivity to desiccationVIRGULA but all seeds were intolerant to levels lower than 45% water content and lost viability at levels lower than 15%. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Essential oil composition of fruit colour varieties of Eugenia brasiliensis LamVIRGULA [Português] Composição dos óleos essenciais de variedades de coloração de frutos de Eugenia brasiliensis Lam
column5: [Português] A espécie Eugenia brasiliensis Lam. apresenta a coloração dos frutos variávelVIRGULA sendo reconhecidas três variedades. EntretantoVIRGULA a definição de variedades não é fácil para espécies de Myrtaceae e também não é amplamente aceita. Duas variedades de Eugenia brasiliensisVIRGULA baseado na cor dos frutos (roxos e amarelos)VIRGULA tiveram a composição de seus óleos essenciais analisadas com a finalidade de obter indícios de variedade botânica para esta espécie. EmboraVIRGULA os componentes principais nos óleos das folhas fossem os mesmos monoterpenos para ambas as variedadesVIRGULA a-pinenoVIRGULA b-pineno e 1VIRGULA8-cineolVIRGULA a variedade com frutos roxos acumulou maior quantidade de sesquiterpenos oxigenados (33VIRGULA9%) do que aquela com frutos amarelos (3VIRGULA8%). As diferenças principais ocorreram nos frutos roxos que apresentaram como componente principal o óxido de cariofileno (22VIRGULA2%) e o a-cadinol (10VIRGULA4%)VIRGULA não detectados no óleo das folhasVIRGULA e o óleo dos frutos amarelos apresentou uma composição similar àquela observada para as folhas. Estas variedades de coloração dos frutos de E. brasilensis podem ser considerados como dois quimiotipos distintosVIRGULA uma vez que na variedade com frutos roxos a rota biossintética para sesquiterpenos encontra-se mais operante do que naquela com frutos amarelosVIRGULA onde são acumulados principalmente os monoterpenos. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] Eugenia brasiliensis Lam. is a variable species concerning fruit colourVIRGULA with three recognized varieties. HoweverVIRGULA the definition of varieties is not easy for Myrtaceae species and not widely accepted. Two fruit colour varieties (purple and yellow) of E. brasiliensis had their essential oil composition analysed in order to give support to the existence of varieties for this species. AlthoughVIRGULA the major components in the leaf oil are the same monoterpenes for both varietiesVIRGULA a-pineneVIRGULA b-pinene and 1VIRGULA8-cineolVIRGULA the purple fruit variety accumulates more oxygenated sesquiterpenes (33.9%) than the one with yellow fruits (3.8%). The major differences occurred in purple fruits that present as major components caryophyllene oxide (22.2%) and a-cadinol (10.4%)VIRGULA not found in the leaf oilVIRGULA and the yellow fruit oil presented a similar composition as observed for the leaves. These fruit colour varieties of E. brasilensis can be considered as two distinct chemotypesVIRGULA since the sesquiterpene pathway is more operant in the purple variety than in the yellow oneVIRGULA in which monoterpenes are mainly accumulated. (AU)

column4: [Português] Composição química dos frutos de Campomanesia adamantium (Cambessédes) O. BergVIRGULA [Inglês] Chemical composition of Campomanesia adamantium (Cambessédes) O. Berg fruits
column5: [Inglês] Fruits of C. adamantium (Myrtaceae) collected in different stages of maturation at Assis State ForestVIRGULA São PauloVIRGULA were evaluated for nutritional compositionVIRGULA volatile oil profile and presence of inorganic elements. The fruit showed a high level of moisture (75.9%)VIRGULA low pH (4.3) and high acidity (1.2 g in citric acid). It is a significant source of vitamin C (234 mg 100 g-1). In the volatile oilVIRGULA 40 compounds were identified corresponding to 93.3% of the oil contents. The major components were a-pinene (10.6%)VIRGULA limonene (10.1%) and the b-(z)-ocimene (9.2%). Among the inorganic elements the nutrients exceed: K (1304 mg kg-1)VIRGULA CaVIRGULA PVIRGULA and Mg from 165 to 175 mg kg-1 concentration and the microelements Fe (11.3 mg kg-1) and Al (15.9 mg kg-1). The caloric value (66.3 kcal 100 g-1) was due almost exclusively to the total carbohydrates (11.6%). O fruto apresentou alto teor de água (75VIRGULA9%)VIRGULA baixo pH (4VIRGULA3) e elevada acidez (1VIRGULA2 g em ácido cítrico). Além dissoVIRGULA destacou-se como excelente fonte de vitamina C (234 mg 100 g-1). No óleo volátilVIRGULA foi possível identificar 40 componentes que corresponderam a 93VIRGULA3% dos compostos presentes. Como componentes majoritários do óleoVIRGULA destacaram-se o a-pineno (10VIRGULA6%)VIRGULA limoneno (10VIRGULA1%) e o b-(z)-ocimeno (9VIRGULA2%). Entre os minerais (16)VIRGULA os principais constituintes foram o K (1304 mg kg-1)VIRGULA CaVIRGULA P e Mg na concentração compreendida entre 165 e 175 mg kg-1 eVIRGULA como micro elementosVIRGULA o Fe (11VIRGULA3 mg kg-1) e o Al (15VIRGULA9 mg kg-1). O valor energético do fruto (66VIRGULA3 kcal 100 g-1) deveu-se quase que exclusivamente aos carboidratos totais (11VIRGULA6%). (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Antimicrobial activity of the essential oil from two specimens of Pimenta pseudocaryophyllus (Gomes) L. R. Landrum (Myrtaceae) native from São Paulo State - Brazil
column5: [Inglês] The antimicrobial activity of the essential oils of two specimens of Pimenta pseudocaryophyllusVIRGULA collected at two locations in São Paulo state-Brazil (Cardoso Island and Paranapiacaba)VIRGULA was determined. The antimicrobial activity was evaluated using the microdilution method against Candida albicans (ATCC 10231)VIRGULA Escherichia coli (ATCC 8739)VIRGULA Pseudomonas aeruginosa (ATCC 9027) and Staphylococcus aureus (ATCC 6538). The best results against E.coli (CIM = 48mL/LPONTOCOMMA CBM = 390uL/L) were obtained with the specimen collected in the Cardoso Island while against P. aeruginosa and S. aureus both specimens showed similar results. HoweverVIRGULA against C. albicansVIRGULA the best results were found with the specimen collected in Paranapicaba (MIC=24uL/L and MBC=97uL/L). The difference in the sensitivity observed might be due to the different chemical compositionVIRGULA in the Cardoso Island specimen the major component was eugenol while in the other one of 4-methyl-eugenol. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Screening of the biological activity from essential oils of native species from the Atlantic Rain Forest (São Paulo - Brazil)
column5: [Inglês] The essential oils from Symphyopappus itatiayensis (Asteraceae)VIRGULA Myrciaria floribunda (Myrtaceae)VIRGULA Talauma ovata (Magnoliaceae)VIRGULA Psidium cattleyanum (Myrtaceae) and Nectandra megapotamica (Lauraceae) were assayed for antimicrobialVIRGULA anti-inflammatory and antitumor activities. All the oils tested were active towards S. aureus and P.aeruginosa and none of them could be considered active against E. coli. The oil of P. cattleyanum was the only one which significantly inhibited the growth of C. albicans (42%). In the anti-inflammatory assayVIRGULA only oils active were those from P. cattleyanum and N. megapotamica and three of them caused toxic effects to the leukocytesVIRGULA M. floribundaVIRGULA S. itatiayensis and T. ovata. The antitumor assay showed that only the oils of N. megapotamica and M. floribunda were able to cause lethality higher than 50% to at least one of the cell line. The results indicated that the essential oils have a pharmacological potential as antimicrobialVIRGULA anti-inflammatory and antitumoral agents. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Essential oils from leaves of two Eugenia brasiliensis specimens from Southeastern Brazil
column5: [Inglês] The essential oils from leaves of two specimens of Eugenia brasiliensis collected at two locations in the south-eastern Brazilian cerrado were analyzed by GC and GC/MS. The main constituents found in the leaf oil from both specimens were ALPHA- and BETA-selinene and BETA-caryophyllene. The specimen collected at Jaboticabal contained BETA-selinene (17.3%) as the major componentVIRGULA while the specimen from Martinho Prado contained ALPHA-selinene (14.8%) as the major compound. AdditionallyVIRGULA the specimen from Martinho Prado produced relatively high amounts of ALPHA- and BETA-pinene (6.6% and 3.6%VIRGULA respectively). (AU)

column5: [Inglês] The essential oils from leaves and fruits of Siparuna guianensis collected in southeastern Brazilian cerrado were analyzed by GC and GC/MS. The fruit oil consisted mainly of 2-undecanone (32.5%)VIRGULA BETA-pinene (19.6%) and limonene (13.6%). (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Volatile oils from leaves and stem barks of Cedrela fissilis (Meliaceae): chemical composition and antibacterial activities
column5: [Inglês] The volatile oils from the leaves and stem barks of Cedrela fissilis were submitted to GC-MS analysis and separation by adsorption chromatography. The fractions were analysed by GCVIRGULA 1H- and 13C-NMR as well as GC-MS. column4: [Inglês] Amazon forests green-up during 2005 drought
column5: [Inglês] Coupled climate-carbon cycle models suggest that Amazon forests are vulnerable to both long- and short-term droughtsVIRGULA but satellite observations showed a large-scale photosynthetic green-up in intact evergreen forests of the Amazon in response to a shortVIRGULA intense drought in 2005. These findings suggest that Amazon forestsVIRGULA although threatened by human-caused deforestation and fire and possibly by more severe long-term droughtsVIRGULA may be more resilient to climate changes than ecosystem models assume. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] The effect of canopy gaps on subcanopy ventilation and scalar fluxes in a tropical forest
column5: [Inglês] Forest gaps may provide conduits that preferentially vent moistVIRGULA CO2-rich subcanopy air to the atmosphere. We measured the above-canopy fluxes of momentumVIRGULA sensible heat (H)VIRGULA CO2VIRGULA and water vapor (Et)VIRGULA and the vertical profiles of CO2 and water vaporVIRGULA from two 67-m meteorological towers in a selectively logged Brazilian rainforest. The logging removed 3.5 trees ha&#8722PONTOCOMMA1VIRGULA and increased the incidence of gaps by a factor of 3 over nearby undisturbed forest. One tower was located in an intact patch of forest within the selectively logged areaPONTOCOMMA the other was 400 m upwind in a large gap created by the logging. During daytime the subcanopy air in the intact patch of forest had more CO2VIRGULA more water vaporVIRGULA and was cooler than the air at comparable altitudes in the gap... (AU)

No BrasilVIRGULA as savanas (conhecidas regionalmente como Cerrado) representam 23% do território brasileiroVIRGULA sendo uma região importante no crescimento nacionalVIRGULA especialmente devido às intensas atividades agrícolas. A finalidade deste trabalho é apresentar uma avaliação dos fluxos de carbonoVIRGULA nitrogênio e principais íons em córregos com diferentes usos do solo (vegetaçãoVIRGULA cana de açúcar e eucalipto) em uma região de CerradoVIRGULA SE Brasil. In BrazilVIRGULA savannas (known regionally as Cerrados) represent 23% of the country's surfaceVIRGULA representing an important share to the national primary growth productVIRGULA especially due to intense agriculture. The purpose of this study is to present a comprehensive evaluationVIRGULA on a yearly basisVIRGULA of carbonVIRGULA nitrogen and major ion fluxes in streams crossing areas under different land use (natural vegetationVIRGULA sugar cane and eucalyptus) in a savanna region of SE Brazil. Eucalyptus and sugar cane alter the transport of the investigated elements in small watersheds... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Soil moisture dynamics in an eastern Amazonian tropical forest
column5: [Inglês] We used frequency-domain reflectometry to make continuousVIRGULA high-resolution measurements for 22 months of the soil moisture to a depth of 10 m in an Amazonian rain forest. We then used these data to determine how soil moisture varies on dielVIRGULA seasonal and multi-year timescalesVIRGULA and to better understand the quantitative and mechanistic relationships between soil moisture and forest evapotranspiration. The mean annual precipitation at the site was over 1900 mm. The field capacity was approximately 053 m3 m-3 and was nearly uniform with soil depth. Soil moisture decreased at all levels during the dry seasonVIRGULA with the minimum of 038 m3 m-3 at 3 m beneath the surface. The moisture in the upper 1 m showed a strong diel cycle with daytime depletion due to evapotranspiration. The moisture beneath 1 m declined during both day and night due to the combined effects of evapotranspirationVIRGULA drainage and a nighttime upward movement of water. The depth of active water withdrawal changed markedly over the year. The upper 2 m of soil supplied 56% of the water used for evapotranspiration in the wet season and 28% of the water used in the dry season. The zone of active water withdrawal extended to a depth of at least 10 m. The day-to-day rates of moisture withdrawal from the upper 10 m of soil during rain-free periods agreed well with simultaneous measurements of whole-forest evapotranspiration made by the eddy covariance technique. The forest at the site was well adapted to the normal cycle of wet and dry seasonsVIRGULA and the dry season had only a small effect on the rates of land-atmosphere water vapour exchange. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Anti-persistence in the global temperature anomaly field
column5: [Inglês] In this studyVIRGULA low-frequency variations in temperature anomaly are investigated by mapping temperature anomaly records onto random walks. We show evidence that global overturns in trends of temperature anomalies occur on decadal time-scales as part of the natural variability of the climate system. Paleoclimatic summer records in Europe and New-Zealand provide further support for these findings as they indicate that anti-persistence of temperature anomalies on decadal time-scale have occurred in the last 226 yrs. Atmospheric processes in the subtropics and mid-latitudes of the SH and interactions with the Southern Oceans seem to play an important role to moderate global variations of temperature on decadal time-scales. (AU)

column4: [Português] Variabilidade do regime de monções sobre o Brasil: o clima presente e projeções para um cenário com 2xCO2 usando o modelo MIROCVIRGULA [Inglês] Variability of the monsoon regime over Brazil: the present climate and projections for a 2xCO2 scenario using the MIROC model
column5: [Português] Este trabalho investiga a variabilidade do Sistema de Monções da América do Sul (SMAS) sobre o Brasil com particular interesse na região do cerrado brasileiro. O inícioVIRGULA final e total de precipitação durante as monções de verão são examinados utilizando estimativas de precipitação por satélite (pêntadas) do Global Precipitation Climatology Project (GPCP) entre 1979-2004. AnalogamenteVIRGULA as características do regime de monção simuladas pelo modelo climático global acoplado MIROC (Model for interdisciplinary Research on Climate) do IPCC (Intergovernmental Panel for Climate Change) são examinadas em dois cenários distintos: o clima do século XX (1981-2000) e o clima em uma condição com o dobro da concentração atual de CO2 (2xCO2) na atmosfera (2061-2080). Mostra-se que a variabilidade espacial do início da monção de verão sobre o cerrado na simulação do clima do século XX pelo MIROC corresponde bem às observações... (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] This study investigates the temporal variability of the South America monsoon system (SAMS) over Brazil with focus on the Brazilian savanna. The onsetVIRGULA endVIRGULA and total rainfall during the summer monsoon are investigated using precipitation pentad estimates from the Global Precipitation Climatology Project (1979-2004). LikewiseVIRGULA the variability of SAMS characteristics are investigated using the intergovernmental Panel for Climate Change (IPCC) coupled global climate model for Interdisciplinary Research (MIROC) in the 20th century (1981-2000) and in a scenario with the double present concentration of CO2 (2xCO2) (2061-2080).. It is shown that the spatial variability of the onsets over central Brazil simulated by MIROC for the 20th century run corresponds very well to the observations. MoreoverVIRGULA there is indication of change in the tails of the seasonal precipitation distributions over the savanna for the scenario with 2xCO2VIRGULA comparatively to the present climate... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Cerrado vegetation study using optical and radar remote sensing: two Brazilian case studies
column5: [Francês] La quantité de phytomasse est un paramètre crucial pour lécologie en général. Les méthodes conventionnelles pour lestimation des paramètres de la phytomasse sont souvent prohibitives en termes de tempsVIRGULA denvironnement et de main-duvre. La saisonnalité dans les physionomies de savane au Brésil est marquée par la perte des feuilles vertes durant la période sèche et la repousse durant la saison humide. Les branches et les troncs demeurent inchangés à travers les saisons. La quantité de composantes de la phytomasse peut être estimée à laide de méthodes non destructives en utilisant la télédétection. Cet article présente des exemples où les capacités de prévision des variations dans la végétation sont testées à laide dimages optiques ou radar. La composante foliaire LAI (« leaf area index »)VIRGULA obtenue sur le terrainVIRGULA est reliée au NDVI (« normalized difference vegetation index ») dérivé dimages satellitairesVIRGULA et les deux méthodes montrent des relations fortes avec la biomasse des feuilles vertes. Des images JERS-1 (« Japanese Earth Resources Satellite ») sont utilisées pour estimer la biomasse ligneuse aérienne. La physionomie de type campo cerrado (savane arbustive) a affiché la plus grande variation au niveau du NDVI alors que la physionomie de type cerradão (savanne arborée) a montré la variation la plus faible du NDVI au cours des saisons. Au cours du mois daoûtVIRGULA plus les valeurs du NDVI sont faiblesVIRGULA plus lalbédo solaire est faible et plus lalbédo PAR (« photosynthetically active radiation ») est élevé. Au cours du mois de novembreVIRGULA plus les valeurs du NDVI sont élevéesVIRGULA plus les valeurs de PAR sont faiblesVIRGULA et plus lalbédo solaire est élevé. La même proportion de variation saisonnière a été observée pour les valeurs de LAI. Une équation pour estimer la biomasse des troncs et des branches utilisant des paramètres allométriques et la rétrodiffusion JERS-1 est proposée. (AU)VIRGULA [Inglês] The amount of phytomass is a crucial parameter in ecology as a whole. Conventional methods to estimate phytomass parameters are often prohibitive in terms of timeVIRGULA environmentVIRGULA and manpower. Seasonality in Brazilian savanna physiognomies is marked by green leaves lost during the dry season and regrowth during the wet season. Branches and trunks remain the same through the seasons. The amounts of the phytomass components can be estimated by nondestructive methods using remote sensing. This paper presents case studies where the abilities to predict vegetation variation are tested using optical and radar images. The foliar component leaf area index (LAI) obtained in the field is related to the normalized difference vegetation index (NDVI) obtained from satellite imagesVIRGULA and both methods present a strong relationship with green leaves biomass. Japanese Earth Resources Satellite (JERS-1) images are used to estimate the aboveground woody biomass. Campo cerrado physiognomy showed the highest seasonal variation in NDVIVIRGULA and cerradão the lowest variation in NDVI. During AugustVIRGULA the lower the NDVI valuesVIRGULA the lower the solar albedo and the higher the photosynthetically active radiation (PAR) albedo. During NovemberVIRGULA the higher the NDVI valuesVIRGULA the lower the PAR and the higher the solar albedo. The same proportion in seasonal variation was observed with LAI values. A significant equation is proposed to estimate trunk and branch biomass using allometric parameters and JERS-1 backscattering. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Facultative autogamy in Cyrtopodium polyphyllum (Orchidaceae) through a rain-assisted pollination mechanism
column5: [Inglês] Cyrtopodium includes -42 speciesVIRGULA among which is Cyrtopodium polyphyllum (Vell.) Pabst ex F. Barros that occurs in a rainforest in south-eastern Brazil. Its non-rewarding flowersVIRGULA which attract Centridini bees by deceitVIRGULA are rain-assisted self-pollinatedVIRGULA a phenomenon rarely found in orchids and other plant families. In additionVIRGULA self-pollination has never been reported in Cyrtopodiinae and data on the pollination of South American orchids are scarce. Flowers were observed at different times of the dayVIRGULA on both sunny and rainy daysVIRGULA to record floral morphologyVIRGULA visitors and the effects of rainfall on flowers. On rainy daysVIRGULA water accumulates on the stigma and dissolves the adhesive substance of the stigmatic surface. A viscous drop thus formsVIRGULA which contacts the pollinarium. When evaporation makes the viscous drop shrinkVIRGULA the drop moves the pollinarium with the anther onto the stigmatic surface and promotes self-pollination. Fruit set in natural habitat was lowVIRGULA with 2.4% at one study siteVIRGULA where a similar value (2.2%) was recorded in flowers self-pollinated by rain. In C. polyphyllumVIRGULA facultative self-pollination assisted by rain is thus an important strategy that guarantees fruit set when pollinator's visits are scarceVIRGULA which is common in species pollinated by deceit. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Karyotype analysis in South American species of Myrtaceae
column5: [Inglês] In Myrtaceae (Myrteae)VIRGULA the diploid chromosome number 2n = 2x = 22 is the most commonVIRGULA although variations of ploidy level occurVIRGULA with some triploid (2n = 3x = 33) and tetraploid (2n = 4x = 44) records. Karyotype details in this group are scarce because the chromosomes are small (< 2 um). In this workVIRGULA we carried out a karyotypic analysis of 15 species of Myrtaceae grouped in different subtribes and genera. Measurements of chromosome length (long armVIRGULA LPONTOCOMMA short armVIRGULA S) were taken and several karyotypic parameters were calculated for each species. The karyotypes in fleshy-fruited taxa (Myrteae) were more varied than in the other previously analysed dry-fruited group (EucalyptusVIRGULA Eucalypteae)VIRGULA in which the chromosomes were exclusively metacentric. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Chromosome studies in GomidesiaVIRGULA MarliereaVIRGULA Myrceugenia and Myrcia (MyrtaceaeVIRGULA subtribe Myrciinae)
column5: [Inglês] In this paper we describe the chromosome numbers of several species of Myrtaceae (subtribe Myrciinae) from south-eastern BrazilVIRGULA in order to help determine the circumscription and limits of this group. The chromosomal counts of 20 species were obtainedVIRGULA 17 of which are new. The number 2n = 22 occurs in almost all of species and genera analysed except for the polyploid species Gomidesia gaudichaudiana and two species of MyrciaVIRGULA with 2n = 44. With these resultsVIRGULA our knowledge of the chromosome number in the subtribe Myrciinae increased from 12 (2.2%) to 29 species (5.4%). The occurrence of 2n = 22 in species of the four genera analysed did not help resolve taxonomic questions relating to the distinction between MyrciaVIRGULA Marlierea and Gomidesia. Although less frequent in MyrciinaeVIRGULA polyploidy appears to have had an important role in the evolution of this familyVIRGULA with high frequency in Eugeniinae (22.5% of Eugenia species) and Myrtinae (50% of the speciesVIRGULA 75% in Psidium). (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Metabolic fingerprinting using direct flow injection electrospray ionization tandem mass spectrometry for the characterization of proanthocyanidins from the barks of Hancornia speciosa
column5: [Inglês] Direct flow injection electrospray ionization ion trap tandem mass spectrometry (ESI-IT-MS/MS) was used to investigate the polyphenolic compounds present in an infusion from the barks of Hancornia speciosa Gom. (Apocynaceae)VIRGULA a native Brazilian plant popularly known as 'mangabeira'VIRGULA used as a source of nutrition and against gastric disorders. After a simple sample filtration pretreatment the characteristic fingerprint of the infusion was performed in negative ion ESI mode in a few minutes. At low capillary-voltage activationVIRGULA the deprotonated molecules ([M-H]-) were observed and using collision-induced dissociation the product ion spectra showed the presence of a homologous series of B-type proanthocyanidinsVIRGULA as well as another series containing their respective C-glycosylated derivativesVIRGULA with a degree of polymerization from 1 up to 6 units of interlinked catechins. ThereforeVIRGULA direct flow injection allowed us to identify the key compounds without preparative isolation of the components. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Constituents and antiulcer effect of Alchornea glandulosa: activation of cell proliferation in gastric mucosa during the healing process
column5: [Inglês] Alchornea glandulosa (Euphorbiaceae) is a plant used in folk medicine as an antiulcer agent. Rats pretreated with methanolic extract obtained from the leaves of A. glandulosa (AG) showed a dose-dependent effect and significant reduction of gastric ulcers induced by absolute ethanol at the doses of 500 (57%) and 1000 mg/kg (85%) in relation to the control group. Pretreatment of mice with AG (500VIRGULA 1000 mg/kgVIRGULA p.o.) showed dose-dependent activity and significantly decreased the severity of lesions caused by HCl/ethanol and by non steroidal anti inflammatory drug-induced gastric lesions. Pretreatment with AG also induced antisecretory action via local and systemic routes and a significant decrease in the total gastric acid content. The gastroprotective effects of AG involved the participation of nitric oxide and increased levels of endogenous sulfhydryl compoundsVIRGULA which are defensive mechanisms of the gastrointestinal mucosa against aggressive factors... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Antiulcerogenic activity of Alchornea castaneaefolia: effects on somatostatinVIRGULA gastrin and prostaglandin
column5: [Inglês] The hydroethanolic extract of the leaves (HEL) and bark (HEB) obtained from Alchornea castaneaefolia (Euphorbiaceae) were investigated for their ability to prevent ulceration of the gastric mucosa in animal models. HEL (500 and 1000 mg/kg) and HEB (1000 mg/kg) significantly reduced the gastric injuries induced by the combination of HCl/ethanol and lowered the severity of gastric damage formation induced by indomethacin/bethanechol in mice. Further investigation showed that HEL also inhibited formation of ulcers in mice submitted to stress and pylorus ligatureVIRGULA but HEL did not modify gastric juice parameters in Shay mice. HEL was also effective in promoting the healing process in chronic gastric ulcer induced by acetic acid in rats. An enriched flavonoidic fraction (EFF at dose of 100 mg/kg) obtained from HEL reduced gastric lesions induced by HCl/ethanol and indomethacin/bethanechol in mice... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Assessment of DNA damage by extracts and fractions of Strychnos pseudoquinaVIRGULA a Brazilian medicinal plant with antiulcerogenic activity
column5: [Inglês] Strychnos pseudoquina St. Hil. is a native plant of the Brazilian SavannahVIRGULA used in popular medicine to treat a number of conditions. No acute toxicity was observed in animals treated with 5 g/kgVIRGULA p.o. of MeOH extract. The mechanism involving the antiulcerogenic action of MeOH extract seemed to be related to NO generation and also suggested the effective participation of endogenous sulfhydryl group in the gastroprotective action... column4: [Inglês] Redescription of Atractus albuquerquei (Serpentes: Colubridae: Dipsadinae)VIRGULA with comments on geographical distribution and intraspecific variation

The LD50 and LD90 values were respectively 31.3 and 104.5 ug insect-1 for compound 1VIRGULA and 122.3 and 381.0 ug insect -1 for compound 2. A dilution assay showed a fast and complete reversal of inhibitionVIRGULA independent of incubation time... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Misconceptions about parsimony analysis of endemicity
column5: [Inglês] Parsimony analysis of endemicity (PAE) has been widely criticized in the recent literature based on methodology rather than on theory. Here I argue that most of the criticisms of PAE result from confusion between the dynamic and static approaches of PAEVIRGULA by both users and critics of the method. OriginallyVIRGULA PAE (the dynamic approach) was proposed primarily for historical comparisons of biotic distributions based on geological and stratigraphical informationPONTOCOMMA that isVIRGULA the stratigraphical record of the biota within two or more horizons was used to evaluate changes (layer by layer) in their distributional patterns. This led to an analysis of the biota throughout space and through time. On the other handVIRGULA the static approach excluded the temporal component and based the analysis on a single geological horizon. Most problems exemplified and discussed in the literature refer to the static approach... (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Endophytic fungi as models for the stereoselective biotransformation of thioridazine
column5: [Inglês] The stereoselective kinetic biotransformation of thioridazineVIRGULA a phenothiazine neuroleptic drugVIRGULA by endophytic fungi was investigated. In generalVIRGULA the sulfur of lateral chain (position 2) or the sulfur of phenothiazinic ring (position 5) were oxidated yielding the major human metabolites thioridazine-2-sulfoxide and thioridazine-5-sulfoxide. The quantity of metabolites biosynthesized varied among the 12 endophytic fungi evaluated. HoweverVIRGULA mono-2-sulfoxidation occurred in higher ratio and frequency. Among the 12 fungi evaluatedVIRGULA 4 of them deserve prominence for presenting an evidenced stereoselective biotransformation: Phomopsis sp. (TD2)VIRGULA Glomerella cingulata (VA1)VIRGULA Diaporthe phaseolorum (VR4)VIRGULA and Aspergillus fumigatus (VR12). Both enantiomers of thioridazine were consumed by the fungiPONTOCOMMA howeverVIRGULA the 2-sulfoxidation yielded preferentially the R configuration at the sulfur atom. (AU)

column5: [Inglês] Two extracellular xylanases produced by the thermotolerant fungus Aspergillus caespitosus grown in sugar cane bagasse were purified and characterized. Estimated molecular masses were 26.3 and 27 kDa (xyl I)PONTOCOMMA 7.7 and 17.7 kDa (xyl II) for gel filtration and SDS-PAGEVIRGULA respectively. Optimal temperature for both xylanases was 50-55ºC. Xylanase activity was inhibited by several ions. ß-mercaptoethanol activated 59 and 102% xyl I and xyl II activitiesVIRGULA respectively. column4: [Inglês] The specialized reproductive mode of the treefrog Aplastodiscus perviridis (Anura: Hylidae)
column5: [Inglês] Males of the South American treefrog Aplastodiscus perviridis construct concealed subterranean nests. Using a complex courtship behavior that involves tactile stimuli and vocalizationsVIRGULA males guide the females to the subterranean nests where eggs are laid. Embryos and facultatively oophagous tadpoles (at least in stage 25) stay in subterranean nests until flooding transports them to ponds or streams. This is a rare reproductive mode previously known for few species in the Hyla albosignata and H. albofrenata complexes. Based on similarities of reproductive mode we suggest a monophyletic origin for Aplastodiscus and these complexes of Hyla. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Reproductive modes in frogs and their unexpected diversity in the Atlantic forest of Brazil
column5: [Inglês] AmphibiansVIRGULA and especially the anurans (frogs and toads)VIRGULA exhibit a greater diversity of reproductive modes than other tetrapod vertebrates. Twenty-nine reproductive modes have been recognized for the anuransPONTOCOMMA we propose 10 moreVIRGULA elevating by more than 34% the number of reproductive modes known for anurans worldwide. These newly recognized reproductive modes for the frogs elevate by almost 48% the number of anuran reproductive modes known for the Neotropics. The highly complex topography of the Atlantic forestVIRGULA breaking up the biome into many small micro-habitatsVIRGULA and the high humidityVIRGULA which reduces desiccation risksVIRGULA have enabled the evolution of reproductive specializations such as eggs or tadpoles that develop out of water. Nearly 90% of the Atlantic forest has been clearedVIRGULA and because several anurans are endemic to this region or have specialized reproductive modes dependent on the forestVIRGULA this partly explains the generalized population declines and large numbers of species that have disappeared in the last few decades. (AU)

column4: [Inglês] Visual communication in Brazilian species of anurans from the Atlantic forest
column5: [Inglês] Visual communication is widespread among several anuran familiesVIRGULA but seems to be more common than currently thought. Four are nocturnal species: Hyalinobatrachium uranoscopum (Centrolenidae)VIRGULA Hyla albomarginataVIRGULA Hyla sp. (aff. ehrhardti)VIRGULA and Scinax eurydice (Hylidae)VIRGULA and two are diurnal species: Hylodes phyllodes and Hylodes asper (Leptodactylidae). For H. uranoscopumVIRGULA H. albomarginataVIRGULA S. eurydiceVIRGULA and H. phyllodesVIRGULA this is the first record of visual communication. Of the 42 anuran species known from Núcleo PicinguabaVIRGULA at least six (approximately 14%) display visual communication.
